371.description: Defines "point-of-sale terminal"; authorizes Department of Lottery to create program that authorizes certain persons to purchase ticket or play slip for lottery game or other games at POS terminal; authorizes department to adopt rules; authorizes department, retailer operating from one or more locations, or vendor approved by department to use POS terminal to sell ticket or play slip for lottery game or other games; requires POS terminal to perform certain functions; prohibits POS terminal from revealing winning numbers; requires Florida lottery, through drawing, to select winning numbers at subsequent time & in different location; prohibits POS terminal from including video depictions of slot machine or casino game themes or titles for game play; prohibits POS terminal from being used to redeem winning ticket.

372.title: Household Moving Services
372.description: Requires movers to conduct physical surveys & provide disclosures & binding estimates; provides for certain waivers; provides that failure to comply with certain provisions violates ch. 507, F.S.; provides criminal penalties; requires DACS to adopt rules & prepare publication regarding rights & responsibilities of, & remedies available to, movers & shippers.

373.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
373.title: Tour-Guide Services
373.description: Excludes tour-guide services from certain regulatory requirements; provides that term "seller of travel" does not include provider of tour-guide services; conforms related provisions.

374.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
374.title: Health Provider Contracts
374.description: Prohibits insurer, prepaid limited health service organization, & HMO, & third-party administrator thereof, from requiring licensed ophthalmologist & optometrist to provide vision care services under specified circumstances; prohibits such entities, & third-party administrators thereof, from requiring licensed ophthalmologist, optometrist, & optician to purchase certain materials & services; specifies that violation of section constitutes specified unfair insurance trade practice & unfair or deceptive act or practice subject to specified civil & administrative actions.

376.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
376.title: Municipal Power Regulation
376.description: Amends definition of "public utility" to include certain entities created under the Florida Interlocal Cooperation Act of 1969.

377.title: Appointment of an Ad Litem
377.description: Defines "ad litem"; authorizes court to appoint ad litem for party upon whom service of process by publication is made; prohibits court from appointing ad litem to represent interest for which personal representative, guardian of property, or trustee is serving; requires ad litem, upon discovery that party it represents is already represented, to take certain actions; prohibits court from requiring ad litem to post bond or designate resident agent; requires court to discharge ad litem when final judgment is entered or as otherwise ordered by court; provides that ad litem is entitled to award of reasonable fee for services & costs & provides for assessment; prohibits declaring court-appointed ad litem ineffective solely due to lack of statutory authority for appointment; provides that section does not abrogate court's common law authority to appoint ad litem.

378.title: Electric Power Rate Study
378.description: Requires OPPAGA to conduct study to determine average rates, charges, & expenses of providing electricity; specifies requirements for study; directs Office of Public Counsel & PSC to provide assistance in obtaining required information as requested; requires report to be provided to Legislature by specified date.

379.title: Rental Agreements
379.description: Provides that purchaser taking title to tenant-occupied residential property following foreclosure sale takes title to property subject to rights of tenant; specifies rights of tenant; authorizes tenant to remain in possession of property for 30-days following receipt of written notice; prescribing form for 30-day notice of termination; establishing requirements for delivery of notice; authorizes purchaser to apply for writ of possession if tenant refuses to vacate property; provides exceptions; provides for construction.

380.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
380.title: Oyster Fishery and Resource Management
380.description: Establishes Nature Coast Oyster Alliance within FWCC; requires alliance to meet certain number of times per year; provides that purpose of the alliance is to coordinate development of comprehensive oyster resource recovery & management plan; requires alliance to establish Oyster Resource Recovery & Management Working Group; assigns certain responsibilities to working group.

381.title: Charging Youths as Adults in Criminal Proceedings
381.description: Specifies offenses that allow state attorney to file information for specified juvenile offenders; prohibits filing informations for juveniles with certain conditions; specifies effects of direct file; prohibits certain juvenile offenders from being transferred to adult court; requires DJJ to collect specified data & make report; specifies minimum age for indictment of juvenile for certain offenses; prohibits certain juvenile offenders from being transferred to adult court; deletes provisions relating to sentencing of juveniles as adults for certain offenses; revises provisions relating to transfer of other pending felony charges when child has been indicted; revises factors to be considered in determining whether to impose juvenile or adult sanctions for violations of law by juvenile; requires court to consider specified reports in hearing on such sentencing; revises provisions relating to sentencing alternatives.

382.title: Aged Prison Inmates
382.description: Requires DOC to consider needs of inmates older than 50 years of age & adopt health care standards for that population; provides for supervised conditional elderly release program; provides criteria for program eligibility; authorizes arrest of inmate who has been released under supervised conditional elderly release program; defines "elderly & infirm inmate"; permits inmates 65 and over to serve less than 85% of their sentences if they receive certain forms of release & requires them to serve a lower minimum percentage of their sentences; expands eligibility for conditional medical release to include elderly & infirm inmates.

383.title: Recycled and Recovered Materials
383.description: Exempts people who sell, transfer, or arrange for transfer of recycled & recovered materials from liability for hazardous substances released or threatened to be released from receiving facilities or sites, under certain circumstances; provides retroactive applicability.

384.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
384.title: Regulatory Minimum Prices
384.description: Defines term "regulatory minimum price"; provides that establishment of regulatory minimum prices for lawful goods or services, or creation of service classifications that would apply differently to certain individuals & businesses is an unfair or deceptive regulatory act; requires DACS to identify instances of regulatory minimum prices & notify noncompliant agencies or entities; clarifies that act does not apply to minimum wages & regulatory fees of governmental entity; provides relief for persons who are adversely affected by certain regulatory actions; requires courts to award reasonable fees, costs, & damages; provides limitation on damages; requires certain interest on sums awarded.

387.title: Swimming Pool Safety
387.description: Requires routine inspections of underwater lighting in public swimming pools; requires disclosures regarding underwater lights in residential swimming pools upon sale of property; requires underwater lighting standards for residential & public swimming pools; requires code to prohibit installation or replacement of underwater lights of greater than specified voltage in new or existing swimming pools.

388.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
388.title: Small Business Financial Assistance
388.description: Creates Veterans Employment Small Business Grant Program within DEO; provides requirements relating to program administration, grant amounts, & participation in program; provides appropriation.

389.title: Tax Disclosures
389.description: Requires specified public entities to disclose on their websites any new or increased tax, fee, or surcharge; requires specified percentage of registered voters located within public body to affirmatively vote for new or increased tax, fee, or surcharge for it to become effective.

390.title: The Beirut Memorial
390.description: Requires Capitol Complex memorial garden to include monument to members of U.S. Armed Forces who lost their lives in Beirut, Lebanon, on specified date.

391.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
391.title: Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance
391.description: Revises legislative intent with respect to financial responsibility for damages caused by operation of motor vehicle; increases financial responsibility limits with respect to bodily injury or death; revises required threshold limit for self-insurers; repeals Florida Motor Vehicle No-Fault Law; provides for termination of personal injury protection policies; requires maintaining minimum security requirements allowing person to respond to property damage & bodily injury by certain date; requires insurer to notify insured about such changes by certain date; provides for applicability of suspensions for failure to maintain security; conforms provisions.

392.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
392.title: Pub. Rec./Bodily Injury Liability Insurance Policies
392.description: Provides public records exemption for certain information regarding bodily injury liability insurance policies; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

393.title: Hair Restoration or Transplant
393.description: Authorizes Board of Medicine, Board of Osteopathic Medicine, & DOH to deny license to or to discipline hair restoration/transplant surgeon for improper delegation or improper acceptance of delegation of certain tasks; authorizes delegation of certain tasks; requires hair restoration/transplant surgeon to document certain information of individual who accepts delegation; requires health care provider of hair restoration/transplant to inform patient of identity & training status of individuals involved in patient's care.

394.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
394.title: Anatomical Gifts
394.description: Authorizes person to make anatomical gift of all or part of his or her body by registering with First Person Consent organ & tissue donor registry during application for driver license, driver license renewal, or ID card; requires DHSMV to develop & issue brochure explaining such registry; requires DHSMV to establish registry & maintain physical or electronic record of such registry; authorizes individual to revise or withdraw consent to be listed in such registry; authorizes DHSMV to establish additional methods by which person may have his or her name included in such registry; authorizes specified representatives to ask DHSMV whether potential organ donor's name is included in such registry.

395.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
395.title: Establishment of Mental Health First Aid Training Program
395.description: Requires DOE to establish mental health first aid training program; provides course requirements & requires certification of instructors; provides for expiration of program; provides appropriation.

396.title: Secondary Metals Recyclers
396.description: Transfers administration of provisions relating to secondary metals recyclers from DOR to DACS; authorizes DOR to share certain confidential information with DACS; provides for designation of agent as appropriate law enforcement official; revises application requirements for registration as secondary metals recycler; requires secondary metals recyclers to maintain specified insurance coverage; requires secondary metals recyclers to exhibit active registration certificates from DACS before applying for or renewing local business tax receipt; requires secondary metals recyclers to allow DACS personnel to enter certain places of business for specified purpose; revises penalties for noncompliance; requires DACS to suspend certain registrations or applications for registration under certain circumstances; prohibits secondary metals recyclers from purchasing regulated metals property, restricted regulated metals property, or ferrous metals on Sundays; provides appropriation.

397.title: Health Professions
397.description: Provides that advertising certification from specialty board, when licensee has not completed certain residency or fellowship, is grounds for discipline.

398.title: Transportation Network Companies
398.description: Provides requirements for operating as a transportation network company or operating as a transportation network company driver.

400.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 396 (Ch. 2015-47)
400.title: Florida Historic Capitol
400.description: Removes references to Legislative Research Center & Museum at Historic Capitol as Florida Historic Capitol Museum; removes provisions authorizing establishment of citizen support organization; creates Florida Historic Capitol Museum Council; provides for appointment & qualifications of council members; prescribes duties & responsibilities for council & individual council members; renames position of Capitol Curator as Florida Historic Capitol Museum Director; revises composition of board of directors governing Florida Historic Capitol Museum's DSO; redirects portion of proceeds from fee for special license plates for former federal or state legislators to Florida Historic Capitol Museum's DSO.

402.title: Family Trust Companies
402.description: Revises provisions relating to Family Trust Company Act; specifies applicability of other chapters to FTCA; revises registration & renewal requirements; revises requirements for OFR investigations, examinations, & suspensions of trust companies; revises acts that may result in penalties & revises penalties.

403.title: Nicotine-Dispensing Devices
403.description: Includes nicotine-dispensing devices intended for specified uses in definition of term "drug paraphernalia" that is deemed contraband; conforms provisions.

404.title: Florida Kidcare Program
404.description: Provides eligibility for optional payments for medical assistance & related services for certain lawfully residing children; clarifies that undocumented immigrants are excluded from eligibility for optional Medicaid payments or related services.

405.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
405.title: Registration of Agriculture Transport Vehicles
405.description: Provides fee for registration of modified agriculture vehicles; provides definition; exempts drivers of modified agriculture vehicles from requirement to possess valid commercial driver license.

406.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 278 (Ch. 2015-43)
406.title: Downtown Development Districts
406.description: Authorizes municipalities larger than certain size located in home rule counties to assess ad valorem tax on certain property in downtown development districts; limits downtown development district's ad valorem millage rate.

407.title: Art Therapy
407.description: Prohibits use of title "art therapist" except by certain persons; provides penalty; creates Board of Professional Art Therapists; provides requirements, with exception, for licensure as art therapist; providing requirements for practice as registered art therapy intern; requires board to establish certain fees; provides grounds for disciplinary action.

408.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
408.title: Student Loan Default Rates
408.description: Requires certain institutions to maintain federal student loan cohort default rate below specified percentage; provides for ineligibility to receive certain grant payments & suspension of licensure if federal student loan cohort default rate rises above specified percentage; defines institution's period of ineligibility & suspension of licensure.

409.title: Property Prepared for Tax-Exempt Use
409.description: Consolidates provisions relating to tax exemptions on property owned by certain tax-exempt organizations; authorizes property appraiser to serve notice of tax lien on certain otherwise exempt properties under certain circumstances; specifies entities to whom lien attaches; provides exemption; deletes provisions rendered obsolete by consolidation.

410.title: Contaminated Sites
410.description: Requires DEP to include protocols for use of long-term natural attenuation where site conditions warrant; requires specified interactive effects of contaminants to be considered as cleanup criteria; revises how cleanup target levels are applied where surface waters are exposed to contaminated groundwater; authorizes use of relevant data & information when assessing cleanup target levels; provides that institutional controls are not required under certain circumstances if using alternative cleanup target levels.

411.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
411.title: Aerial Photographs and Nonproperty Ownership Maps
411.description: Requires DOR to pay cost of furnishing certain aerial photographs & nonproperty ownership maps for certain tax purposes.

412.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 133 (Ch. 2015-133)
412.title: Sexting
412.description: Removes court's discretion to impose specified penalty for first violation of sexting; requires minor cited for first violation to sign & accept citation to appear or, in lieu of appearing, to complete other sanctions; requires citation to include certain information; authorizes court to order certain penalties; requires specified percentage of civil penalties be remitted to county commission for cyber-safety training for minors.

414.last_action: Died in Rulemaking Oversight and Repeal Subcommittee
414.title: Legislative Ratification/Department of Environmental Protection
414.description: Requires DEP to submit for legislative ratification state plan relating to standards of performance for existing sources of air pollutants; provides directives to DEP with respect to submittal of initial state plan to EPA; requires legislative ratification of other legally binding actions of executive branch relating to standards of performance for existing sources of air pollutants.

415.title: Manatee County
415.description: Provides that unpaid rentals, rates, or charges for services & facilities of utility system constitute lien on any parcel or property affected by such services or facilities.

416.title: Canvassing of Absentee Ballots
416.description: Revises period during which absentee ballots may be canvassed; revises instructions to electors provided with absentee ballots to revise date by which absentee elector must submit updated signature in voter registration file used to verify signature on absentee ballot voter's certificate, to conform.

417.title: K-12 Educational Instruction
417.description: Creates State Seal of Biliteracy; creates English Language Learners Advisory Council; requires DOE to provide for development & adoption of statewide, standardized assessments in certain languages; revises components used to establish school grades to include certain Learning Gains of English language learners.

418.last_action: Chapter No. 2015-188, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 861 (Ch. 2015-189)
418.title: Greater Naples Fire Rescue District, Collier County

420.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
420.title: Health Insurance
420.description: Designates act as "Florida Patient Protection Act"; revises prescription drug coverage requirements for managed care plans; provides for appeal of certain health care coverage decisions made by managed care plans, health insurers, & HMOs; authorizes OIR to hold certain public hearings; requires OIR to issue certain reports annually; prohibits discriminatory benefit plans; provides penalties for use of discriminatory treatment criteria; provides requirements for certain civil actions brought against insurer or HMO; provides penalties & attorney fees.

421.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
421.title: Renewable Energy Source Devices
421.description: Implements proposed amendment to State Constitution; exempts assessed value of certain renewable energy source devices from tangible personal property tax; prohibits consideration of installation of such devices in determination of assessed value of real property for ad valorem taxation purposes.

422.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
422.title: Broward County
422.description: Repeals provisions relating to authority of Florida Marine Patrol to designate location of speed limit signs on New River Canal & Florida Intracoastal Waterway, requirement that county & incorporated areas bear cost of erecting signs, & nonapplicability of certain speed limit requirements in regulatory zones, idle speed/no wake zones, & manatee areas.

423.title: City of Weston and Town of Davie, Broward County
423.description: Adjusts corporate limits of city & town to clarify boundaries.

424.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1216 (Ch. 2015-30)
424.title: Regional Planning Councils
424.description: Repeals provisions creating regional planning councils & regional planning agencies; repeals provisions specifying duties of such councils & agencies; transfers duties formerly performed by such councils & agencies to state land planning agency or local governments, as appropriate; authorizes local governments to create regional planning entities.

426.title: Assessments and Accountability
426.description: Authorizes school district to select certain assessments to administer instead of statewide, standardized assessments; provides for selection of assessments, funding, & scoring of assessments; requires SBE to ensure against certain repercussions; exempts certain students from participation in statewide, standardized assessment program; provides for administration of paper-based assessments; revises definitions relating to school grading system.

427.title: Use of Deadly Force
427.description: Limits application of stand your ground law to instances in which attacker commits an overt act that leads person who is attacked to believe that it is necessary to meet force with force; removes references to threatened use of force; provides that immunity from civil & criminal liability for certain uses of deadly force does not apply if person injures child or bystander who is not affiliated with overt act.

428.title: Mandatory Minimum Sentencing
428.description: Designates act as "The Alexander-Giles Act"; authorizes judge to impose sentence of less than mandatory minimum sentence; requires judge to state in writing reasons for departing from or adhering to mandatory minimum sentence; provides factors to consider.

429.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
429.title: Beverage Law
429.description: Provides exemption from provisions relating to tied house evil for specified financial transactions between manufacturer of beer or malt beverages & licensed vendor.

430.title: Clerks of the Court
430.description: Provides for specified fees & fines to be deposited into clerks' fine & forfeiture fund instead of General Revenue; revises list of court-related functions that clerks of circuit court may fund from fees, charges, costs, & fines; provides annual transfer of specified funds to Clerks of Court Trust Fund rather than to General Revenue Fund; provides for state responsibility for jury-related costs; provides for reimbursement to clerks of court for jury-related costs; provides for apportionment of reimbursement for jury-related costs; specifies authorized budget for clerks of circuit court for 2015-2016 county fiscal year; authorizes Florida Clerks of Court Operations Corporation to determine budget amounts for individual clerks for that period.

432.title: Health Care Representatives
432.description: Providing an exception for a patient who has designated a surrogate to make health care decisions and receive health information without a determination of incapacity being required; revising provisions relating to the designation of health care surrogates; providing for the designation of health care surrogates for minors; specifying that a principal's wishes are controlling while he or she has decisionmaking capacity, etc.

433.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
433.title: Research and Development Tax Credits
433.description: Increases total amount of research & development tax credits for certain businesses.

434.title: Blanket Health Insurance Eligibility
434.description: Revises list of special groups of individuals covered by policy or contract for blanket health insurance.

435.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 1094 (Ch. 2015-69)
435.title: Peril of Flood
435.description: Provides requirements for coastal management element of local government comprehensive plans; requires certain people to complete elevation data & submit information to Division of Emergency Management; authorizes flexible flood insurance; specifies coverage requirements; revises various provisions regarding provision of flood insurance by insurers.

437.title: North Collier Fire Control and Rescue District, Collier County
437.description: Merges Big Corkscrew Island Fire Control & Rescue District & the North Naples Fire Control & Rescue District to create independent special district; provides charter.

438.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
438.title: Pasco County
438.description: Repeals certain provisions relating to sewage treatment facility discharges into coastal waters within Pasco County or waters tributary thereto.

439.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
439.title: Economic Development
439.description: Repeals scheduled repeal of Florida Enterprise Zone Act; deletes individual limits on certain sales tax refunds; provides cumulative annual limits; revises various provisions relating to Rural Job Tax Credit Program, Rural Infrastructure Fund, & tax refund program for qualified target industry businesses; conforms provisions.

440.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
440.title: An Exemption from Sales & Use Tax for Electrical & Hydrogen Vehicles
440.description: Exempts the sales & use tax from the sale of electric & hydrogen vehicles until specified date.

441.last_action: Died in Government Operations Appropriations Subcommittee
441.title: Public Depositories
441.description: Revises terms applicable to Florida Security for Public Deposits Act to add credit unions to list of entities that may qualify as "qualified public depository"; revises evidence of insurance required to be submitted by public depositor to CFO.

443.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
443.title: Residential Construction
443.description: Directs Florida Building Commission to adopt requirement within Florida Building Code that, on or after specified date, all newly constructed residential buildings have solar thermal compatible system; defines term "solar thermal compatible system."

444.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7024 (Ch. 2015-75)
444.title: State Board of Administration
444.description: Repeals provisions relating to investments in institutions doing business in or with Northern Ireland; provides for distribution of Fund B Surplus Funds Trust Fund assets to certain participants.

445.title: Building Codes
445.description: Revising the certification examination requirements for building code inspectors, plans examiners, and building code administrators; exempting certain low-voltage landscape lighting from licensed electrical contractor installation requirements; authorizing local boards created to address specified issues to combine the appeals boards to create a single, local board; repealing provisions relating to statements of estimated regulatory costs; creating the Calder Sloan Swimming Pool Electrical-Safety Task Force within the Florida Building Commission, etc.

446.title: Cattle Market Development Act
446.description: Renames Beef Market Development Act as Cattle Market Development Act & Florida Beef Council, Inc., as Cattle Enhancement Board, Inc.; removes provision that deems cow & nursing calf sold together as one unit; removes provisions authorizing the Cattle Enhancement Board to hold referenda on per-head-of-cattle assessments & collect & refund such assessments; removes provisions requiring that the Cattle Enhancement Board develop new uses for beef products & improve methods for distribution of such products; revises terms & appointments of governing board members; provides for commissioner to appoint governing board members; removes provisions requiring board to maintain communication with certain industry representatives; removes provisions to maintain certain financial reserves & to appoint advisory groups; revises scheduled date of repeal of act.

447.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
447.title: Special Assessment for Law Enforcement Services
447.description: Authorizes municipalities to levy special assessments to fund costs of providing law enforcement services; requires that municipalities meet certain criteria to levy & collect special assessment; provides methodology for apportionment of special assessment & reduction of ad valorem millage; requires property appraiser to list special assessments on notices of property taxes; provides for termination of municipality's authority to levy special assessment; authorizes DOR to adopt certain rules & forms.

448.title: Motor Vehicle Manufacturers, Factory Branches, Distributors, Importers, & Dealers
448.description: Revises provisions that prohibit & limit audits of certain payments & denial or reduction of such payments; revises provisions that restrict adverse action against dealer when vehicle that was delivered to customer is resold or exported out of state; prohibits failing to make payment for replacement vehicle provided by dealer to customer; & prohibits requiring dealer to make certain payments for advertising.

449.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
449.title: Local Government
449.description: Authorizes use of impact fees for new & existing capital facilities; authorizes county or municipality to impose surcharge on certain real property transactions in lieu of assessing impact fees; restricts amount of surcharge; specifies procedures enacting ordinance to authorize surcharge; requires county or municipality to deposit revenues into special trust fund; specifies authorized uses of surcharge revenues; prohibits county or municipality that imposes surcharge from assessing an impact fee for same purpose.

450.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
450.title: Postsecondary Education Fees
450.description: Requires state universities to waive specific fees for graduate students with certain appointments.

451.title: Title Insurance
451.description: Revising procedures and requirements relating to the recovery of assessments from title insurers through surcharges assessed on policies; revising requirements for the payment of excess surcharges to the Insurance Regulatory Trust Fund; authorizing the Financial Services Commission and the Department of Financial Services to adopt rules for certain purposes, etc.

452.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
452.title: Wireless Communications Devices
452.description: Prohibits person from operating motor vehicle while dialing, or talking or listening on, wireless communications device for purpose of interpersonal communication or while using wireless communications device to view or post an electronic message or initiate command to Internet.

453.title: Interstate Compacts
453.description: Adopts & enters state into interstate Compact for Balanced Budget; exempts compact from Article V Constitutional Convention Act; provides for proposal by compact's member states of amendment to U.S. Constitution requiring Federal Government to maintain balanced budget with certain exceptions; provides for member states to apply to Congress for convention under Article V of U.S. Constitution to propose balanced budget amendment; provides for appointment, terms, duties, & authority of convention delegates; requires oath by delegates; specifies rules governing procedures at convention; establishes Compact Commission & specifies commission's membership & duties; provides for appointment of Compact Administrator & specifies administrator's duties.

455.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 642 (Ch. 2015-56), CS/CS/SB 644 (Ch. 2015-57), CS/CS/SB 646 (Ch. 2015-58)
455.title: Individuals with Disabilities
455.description: Creates "Florida Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Act"; requires Florida Prepaid College Board to establish direct-support organization known as "Florida ABLE, Inc."; authorizes organization to use certain services, property, & facilities of Florida Prepaid College Board; provides that specified moneys, assets, & income of qualified ABLE program, including Florida ABLE program, are not subject to attachment, levy, garnishment, or certain legal process in favor of certain creditors or claimants.

456.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 644 (Ch. 2015-57), CS/SB 642 (Ch. 2015-56)
456.title: Trust Funds/Florida ABLE Trust Fund/State Board of Administration
456.description: Creates Florida ABLE Trust Fund within State Board of Administration; authorizes sources of funds; specifies purpose of trust fund & authorized uses of assets; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides for contingent effect.

457.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 646 (Ch. 2015-58), CS/SB 642 (Ch. 2015-56)
457.title: Pub. Rec./Florida Prepaid College Board/Florida ABLE, Inc./Florida ABLE Program
457.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain personal financial & health information held by Florida Prepaid College Board, Florida ABLE, Inc., Florida ABLE program, or agent or service provider thereof; authorizes release of such information under specified circumstances; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides for contingent effect.

458.title: Prejudgment Interest
458.description: Provides for prejudgment interest in actions in which plaintiff is entitled to monetary damages; provides retroactive applicability.

460.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
460.title: Medical Tourism
460.description: Requires OPPAGA to perform economic development analysis of medical tourism; creates medical tourism marketing plan within Enterprise Florida; requires Division of Tourism Marketing to promote medical tourism; provides requirements; requires certain funds to be allocated for the medical tourism marketing plan.

461.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
461.title: Property Insurance
461.description: Provides that an insurer's projected payout shall be treated as insurer's coverage amount; revises application of provisions relating to claims based on state of emergency; revises factors considered by OIR when reviewing rate filings; provides that an insurer is not prohibited from using specified averages for rate filings; deletes certain residential property insurance filing requirements; revises private market reinsurance criteria; exempts certain personal lines residential structures & single condominium units from annual rate increases; limits eligibility for coverage by corporation for personal lines risk.

462.title: Dietetics and Nutrition
462.description: Authorizes certain certified individuals to use specified titles & designations; requires Board of Medicine to waive examination requirement for specified applicants; provides that licensed dietitian/nutritionist treating patient who is under active care of licensed physician/licensed chiropractor is not precluded from ordering therapeutic diet.

463.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
463.title: Hospital Districts
463.description: Defines "hospital district"; requires decennial reauthorization of taxing authority of certain hospital districts; prohibits hospital districts from levying property tax without consent of electors residing within hospital district; terminating taxing authority of hospital district if referenda are not approved by majority vote of electors; provides for allocation of hospital district assets & liabilities; provides requirements for creation, expansion, or combining of certain hospital districts; requires certain public hospitals to prepare economic analysis; provides requirements for such analysis; prohibits hospital district from levying property tax without referendum of electors pursuant to act; provides referendum requirement for property tax levy contingent upon future government-subsidized health care funding.

464.title: Transmission of Pornography
464.description: Provides that each act of sending or delivering child pornography is separate offense; reenacts provisions.

467.title: Electronic Noticing of Trust Accounts
467.description: Authorizes sender to post certain documents to secure electronic site with recipient approval; provides instructions for effectuating such approval; specifies when documents & messages sent electronically are deemed received; specifies how authorization of electronic receipt of documents are made; requires sender to provide notice of beginning of limitations period; establishes burdens of proof for determining whether proper notifications were provided; specifies that electronic messages are deemed received when sent; specifies that service of certain documents are governed by Florida Rules of Civil Procedure.

469.title: Agency Relationships with Governmental Health Care Contractors
469.description: Extends sovereign immunity to employees or agents of health care provider that executes contract with governmental contractor; authorizes such health care provider to collect nominal fee for administrative costs; limits nominal fee; clarifies that receipt of specified notice must be acknowledged by patient or patient's representative at initial visit; requires posting of notice.

470.title: Trespass on Airport Property
470.description: Provides enhanced criminal penalties for trespass upon operational area of airport with specified intent if specified signage is posted.

471.title: North Springs Improvement District, Broward County

472.title: Absentee Voting
472.description: Replaces references to term "absentee ballot" with "vote-by-mail ballot;" conforms provisions.

473.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1216 (Ch. 2015-30)
473.title: Improvements to Real Property Damaged by Subsidence
473.description: Expands definition of term "qualifying improvement" to include stabilization or other repairs to real property damaged by subsidence; provides that stabilization or other repairs to real property damaged by subsidence are qualifying improvements considered affixed to building or facility; revises disclosure requirements; expands definition of term "blighted area"; prohibits community redevelopment agency from paying attorney fees & public adjuster fees under certain conditions.

475.title: Discrimination in Employment Screening
475.description: Prohibits employer from inquiring into or considering applicant's criminal record on initial employment application unless required by law.

476.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 766 (Ch. 2015-26)
476.title: Drone Surveillance
476.description: Designates act as "Florida Drone Privacy Act"; requires FDLE to develop guidelines for use of drones by state or local law enforcement agencies; requires such law enforcement agencies to annually report to FDLE, & requires FDLE to annually report to Governor & Legislature, regarding drone usage; specifies situations in which it is lawful to capture image with drone; prohibits capture of image of individual or privately owned real property using drone in certain circumstances; prohibits possession, disclosure, display, distribution, or use of such illegally captured images; provides defenses to prosecution; prohibits use or discovery of such images in legal proceedings; provides exceptions; provides for civil actions for damages relating to violations; provides for court costs & attorney fees; specifies limitations period for such actions; provides criminal penalties.

477.last_action: Withdrawn prior to introduction, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1049 (Ch. 2015-127)
477.title: Practice of Pharmacy
477.description: Provides that Florida Pharmacy Act does not prohibit the dispensing of compounded drug in practice of veterinary medicine.

478.title: Village of Estero, Lee County
478.description: Provides continuing effect of certain developments of regional impact; delays compliance with state-shared revenue requirements; authorizes millage levied by Estero Fire Rescue District to be used for certain purposes; revises corporate & council district boundaries.

479.title: Maintenance of Agency Final Orders
479.description: Requires agencies to electronically transmit certain agency final orders to centralized electronic database maintained by DOAH; revises provisions for searching & maintaining lists of final orders; provides timeframe for electronically transmitting or listing final orders; provides that centralized electronic database is official compilation of final orders issued on or after certain date for each agency; requires DOS to set standards & guidelines for certifying, electronically transmitting, & ensuring security of copies of agency final orders; authorizes alternative official compiler of agency final orders under certain circumstances.

480.last_action: Died in Government Operations Appropriations Subcommittee
480.title: Organization of Department of Financial Services
480.description: Revises functions & divisions of DFS; authorizes CFO to establish divisions, bureaus, or offices of DFS; provides & deletes certain requirements of Florida Clerks of Court Operations Corporation; exempts DFS' audit & accounting positions from career service requirements; provides powers & duties of Division of Consumer Services; authorizes division to impose certain penalties; authorizes DFS to adopt rules relating to division; requires deposit of certain service of process fees into Administrative Trust Fund.

481.title: Expressway Authorities
481.description: Revises membership & qualifications for membership on governing body of certain expressway authorities; provides for termination from an authority's governing body upon finding of violation of specified ethical conduct provisions or failure to comply with notice of failure to comply with financial disclosure requirements.

482.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
482.title: Downtown Development Authority of City of Fort Lauderdale, Broward County
482.description: Adds certain residential property to boundaries; revises procedures for final adoption of budget & millage; requires referendum.

483.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
483.title: Rapid Response Education and Training Program
483.description: Establishes Rapid Response Education & Training Program within Complete Florida Plus Program; requires Complete Florida Plus Program to work with Enterprise Florida, Inc., to offer certain education & training commitments to businesses; specifies duties of program; requires reports to Legislature; requires DOE's Division of Career & Adult Education to conduct analysis & assessment of effectiveness of education & training programs.

484.title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
484.description: Waiving the initial land surveying and mapping license fee for certain veterans of the United States Armed Forces, the spouses of such veterans, or a business entity that has a majority ownership held by such a veteran or spouse; requiring that the initial license application for private investigative, private security, and repossession services include payment of fingerprint processing and fingerprint retention fees; directing the Department of Law Enforcement to retain fingerprints submitted for private investigative, private security, and repossession service licenses, to enter such fingerprints into the statewide automated biometric identification system and the national retained print arrest notification program, and to report any arrest record information to the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, etc.

485.last_action: Veto Message received (2015 Special Session A)
485.title: Pub. Rec./Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
485.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for criminal or civil intelligence or investigative information or any other information held by DACS as part of investigation with another state or federal regulatory, administrative, or criminal justice agency; provides exceptions to exemption; provides applicability; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

486.title: Recovery Care Services
486.description: Includes recovery care centers as facilities licensed under ch. 395, F.S.; provides admission criteria for recovery care center; requires emergency care, transfer, & discharge protocols; authorizes AHCA to establish separate standards for recovery care centers for care & treatment of patients; directs agency to enforce special-occupancy provisions of Florida Building Code applicable to recovery care centers; provides applicability of Health Care Licensing Procedures Act; exempts recovery care centers from specified minimum licensure requirements.

487.last_action: Chapter No. 2015-126, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 7018 (Ch. 2015-31)
487.title: Assisted Living Facilities
487.description: Provides respective responsibilities of Medicaid prepaid behavioral health plans & managing entities under contract with DCF for mental health residents residing in ALFs; requires certain facilities licensed as ALFs to be licensed as extended congregate care facilities.

488.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
488.title: Community Investment Program
488.description: Establishes Community Investment Program within DEO to encourage investment & reduce poverty in economically disadvantaged communities; establishes Community Investment Council to govern program; provides for membership & duties of council; requires annual report to Governor & Legislature; provides program goals & objectives; establishes legislative advisory committee to advise council.

489.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee
489.title: Behavioral Health Services
489.description: Creates Behavioral Health Task Force within DCF; requests Florida Supreme Court's Task Force on Substance Abuse & Mental Health Issues in Courts to act as subcommittee of task force; revises duties of Criminal Justice, Mental Health, & Substance Abuse Statewide Grant Review Committee; creates statewide Center for Excellence for Criminal Justice, Mental Health, & Substance Abuse at current Criminal Justice, Mental Health, & Substance Abuse Technical Assistance Center; establishes Behavioral Health Workforce Loan Forgiveness Program within DCF.

490.title: Minority Impact Statements
490.description: Requires that bills creating new criminal offense, modify existing criminal offense, or modify penalty for existing criminal offense be referred upon filing & before consideration to EDR for preparation of minority impact statement; authorizes EDR to request assistance of executive agency; specifies requirements for statement; requires EDR to issue finding as to whether bill has disparate impact on members of racial minority groups; requires that bill sponsor take certain action if EDR finds disparate impact on racial minority groups; requires that, if statement is required of sponsor, it be included as appendix to minority impact statement.

491.title: Spouses of Military Servicemembers
491.description: Prohibits employing agencies from compelling employees who are spouses of military servicemembers to work, or impose sanctions or penalties upon such employees for failure or refusal to work, extended hours during active military service deployment of spouse under specified circumstances; requires employing agencies to grant requests from such employees for certain unpaid leave; authorizes DMS to adopt rules.

492.title: Addresses of Legal Residence
492.description: Defines "address of legal residence"; requires voter registration application to include applicant's address of legal residence; provides that list of valid addresses maintained by supervisor of elections must include certain additional distinguishing information.

493.title: Maximum Reimbursement Allowances for Workers' Compensation Medical Services
493.description: Revises process for establishing schedules of maximum reimbursement allowances; provides that adoption of schedules of maximum reimbursement allowances is subject to administrative proceedings & judicial review.

494.title: Pub. Rec./Law Enforcement & Specified Government Attorneys
494.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain identifying information related to active or former sworn or civilian law enforcement personnel & other specified agency personnel & current or former state attorneys, assistant state attorneys, statewide prosecutors, assistant statewide prosecutors, public defenders, assistant public defenders, criminal conflict & civil regional counsel, & assistant criminal conflict & civil regional counsel, & their parents, siblings, or cohabitants; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity.

495.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee
495.title: Mental Health and Substance Abuse
495.description: Authorizes family member of patient or an interested party to petition court for appointment of guardian advocate; establishes Substance Abuse Assistance Pilot Program within DCF; creates "Jennifer Act"; authorizes adult with capacity to execute mental health or substance abuse treatment advance directive; establishes requirements for directive; provides circumstances under which directive may be revoked; provides circumstances under which principal may waive specific directive provisions without revoking directive; specifies conditions under which principal may be admitted for inpatient mental health or substance abuse treatment; requires express consent in directive for administration of psychotropic medication; requires conditions for administering such medication; prohibits principal from authorizing psychosurgery or electroconvulsive therapy in directive; provides for recognition of mental health & substance abuse treatment advanced directive executed in another state if it complies with laws of this state.

496.title: Protection of Licensed Health Care Workers
496.description: Prohibits employer from taking disciplinary action against licensed health care worker in employment of employer under certain circumstances.

497.title: Health Insurance for Opioids
497.description: Provides that health insurance policy that covers opioid analgesic drug products may impose prior authorization requirement for abuse-deterrent opioid analgesic drug product only if insurer imposes same requirement for corresponding opioid analgesic drug product without abuse-deterrence labeling claim; prohibits such policy from requiring use of opioid analgesic drug product without abuse-deterrence labeling claim before authorizing use of abuse-deterrent opioid analgesic drug product; provides that section does not require coverage of certain drug products.

499.title: Firesafety
499.description: Exempts certain nonresidential farm buildings from Florida Fire Prevention Code if certain criteria are met; exempts agricultural pole barns & certain tents from Florida Fire Prevention Code; authorizes local fire officials to consider specified publication when identifying alternative to firesafety code; requires State Fire Marshal to conduct specific study related to nonresidential farm buildings.

500.title: Legislative Apportionment and Congressional Redistricting
500.description: Creates independent commission on legislative apportionment & congressional redistricting; provides for purpose, duties, membership, & funding of commission; requires commission to employ professional staff, hold certain hearings, & transmit certain plans to Legislature for consideration; subjects commission to government-in-the-sunshine & financial disclosure requirements; prohibits persons not serving on or employed by commission from influencing or attempting to influence commission members & employees other than through prescribed processes; provides criminal penalties.

501.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
501.title: Liquid Nitrogen
501.description: Defines "liquid nitrogen" & "inadequately ventilated area"; requires public food service establishments & vendors licensed under Beverage Law to provide training of restaurant & bar personnel in use of liquid nitrogen in preparing food & alcoholic beverages & notice to customers regarding dangers of consuming liquid nitrogen; requires rulemaking.

502.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
502.title: Postsecondary Education Student Debt
502.description: Revises accountability standards for Florida College System institutions & state universities; prohibits institution whose student default risk index exceeds specified percentage from grant payments until certain criteria are met; establishes Student Loan Debt Advisory Council; providing for membership, organization, duties of the advisory council; requires BOG to include student default risk index in certain models; requires OPPAGA study.

504.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
504.title: Insurance
504.description: Provides regulation requirements for premium for single interest insurance placed by financial institutions.

505.title: Electronic Monitoring Devices
505.description: Prohibits person from removing, destroying, altering, tampering with, damaging, or circumventing operation of electronic monitoring device being worn or used pursuant to any court order or order by Commission on Offender Review; prohibits requesting or soliciting person to perform such act; provides criminal penalties; specifies that DOC may electronically monitor offender sentenced to community control when court has imposed electronic monitoring as condition of community control.

506.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 904 (Ch. 2015-66)
506.title: Home Health Services
506.description: Provides for licensure of more than one nurse registry operational site within same health service planning district; allows home health agencies to operate related offices inside main office's health service planning district without additional license; authorizes licensed nurse registry to operate satellite office; requires nurse registry operational site to keep original records; requires nurse registry to provide notice & certain evidence before it relocates operational site or opens satellite office.

507.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1312 (Ch. 2015-70)
507.title: Strategic Lawsuits Against Public Participation
507.description: Provides that legislative intent includes protection of specified forms of free speech; defines phrase "free speech in connection with public issues"; conforms provisions.

508.title: Housing Authorities
508.description: Provides for creation of consolidated housing authorities under certain conditions; provides requirements; provides area of operation of consolidated housing authority; provides duties of governing body of county or municipality included in area of operation; provides public hearing requirements; provides for appointment of commissioners; provides powers & duties of consolidated housing authority & its commissioners; authorizes consolidated housing authority to borrow money, accept grants, & exercise its other powers for certain purposes; authorizes consolidated housing authority to execute mortgages encumbering real property for certain purposes.

509.title: Instruction for Homebound and Hospitalized Students
509.description: Requires school districts to provide instruction to homebound or hospitalized students; provides for student eligibility, methods of providing instruction to homebound or hospitalized students, & initiation of services.

510.title: Secondhand Dealers
510.description: Requires law enforcement officer with jurisdiction to place specified written hold order on certain goods.

512.title: Shootings Involving Law Enforcement Officers
512.description: Requires each judicial circuit to create local advisory panel; requires advisory panel to take specified actions; provides for advisory panel membership & terms; requires advisory panel to vote on whether to indict law enforcement officer; requires state attorney to consider decision of panel & to indict law enforcement officer in certain circumstances; provides for expiration.

513.last_action: Died in Banking and Insurance, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 165 (Ch. 2015-135)
513.title: Motor Vehicle Insurance
513.description: Authorizing a joint underwriting plan and the Florida Automobile Joint Underwriting Association to cancel certain insurance policies within a specified period under certain circumstances; revising the period during which the applicable fee schedule or payment limitation under Medicare applies with respect to certain personal injury protection insurance coverage, etc.

514.title: Child Protection
514.description: Providing requirements for the representation of Children's Medical Services on multiagency teams investigating certain child deaths or other serious incidents; requiring the Statewide Medical Director for Child Protection and the district medical directors to hold certain qualifications; providing that a physician who holds an expert witness certificate may provide expert testimony in criminal child abuse and neglect cases, etc.

515.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
515.title: Law Enforcement Training
515.description: Requires FAMU & Florida Memorial University to establish Law Enforcement Academy for Diverse Communities; specifies requirements for academy's curriculum; authorizes additional functions.

516.title: Community Schools Initiative
516.description: Requires DOE to implement "Reigniting Education Achievement with Coordinated Help" (REACH) Program as public-private partnership in lowest-performing public schools; specifies services to be offered with goal of improving student academic achievement.

517.title: Nursing Home Guides
517.description: Requires AHCA to publish Gold Seal designations in Nursing Home Guide; requires nursing home facility to post Gold Seal designation signs; requires nursing home on Nursing Home Guide Watch List to provide notice containing certain information to primary familial contact for each resident.

518.title: Government Accountability
518.description: Revises audit provisions to exclude water management districts; revises responsibilities of department heads, Supreme Court, Florida Clerks of Court Operations Corporation, Justice Administrative Commission, each state attorney & public defender, criminal conflict & civil regional counsel, capital collateral counsel, Guardian Ad Litem program, local governmental entities, & governing bodies of charter schools to include responsibility of establishing certain internal controls; requires each Florida College System institution to file certain annual financial statements with State Board of Education; requires each school district, Florida College System institution, & state university to establish certain internal controls.

519.title: Law Enforcement Lethal Use of Force Commission
519.description: Provides for membership of commission; specifies membership requirements; requires law enforcement agencies to report use-of-force incidents resulting in fatalities to commission; requires state attorneys & other prosecuting entities to notify commission of inquiries into use-of-force fatalities & upon determining not to pursue charges; requires commission to review lethal use-of-force incidents; authorizes commission to refer incidents to AG for consideration of prosecution; authorizes commission to subpoena documents & witnesses; authorizes AG to bring criminal charges; prohibits actions of commission that could constitute double jeopardy.

520.title: Punitive Damages
520.description: Deletes language applying punitive damages limitation for certain civil actions prospectively only & applies it to all actions in which judgment has not been entered, regardless of when cause of action arose.

521.title: Defendants in Specialized Courts
521.description: Requires trial court to transfer certain criminal cases involving participants in specified programs to another jurisdiction having such program under certain conditions.

522.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
522.title: William L. Boyd, IV, Florida Resident Access Grant Program
522.description: Provides that independent college or university that was successor by merger to certain independent colleges or universities is eligible to receive William L. Boyd, IV, Florida resident access grant payments.

523.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
523.title: Water Oversight and Planning
523.description: Establishes Water Oversight & Planning Board to address state water issues; provides membership for board; provides duties of board; requires board to submit long-range plans to DEP & water management districts; requires water management districts to amend regional water supply plans in certain circumstances; requires board to provide to Legislature recommendations for appropriations & legislative changes.

524.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
524.title: Renewable Energy
524.description: Authorizes specified entities to install & operate renewable energy source devices on certain structures where business operates; authorizes owner to sell electricity generated from device to certain businesses; authorizes electric utility to install & operate renewable energy source device on structure where business operates & sell electricity to business or others; authorizes electric utility to recover certain costs; authorizes customers to challenge certain fees.

526.title: Consumer Loans
526.description: Provides terms for certain consumer loans made by licensees; specifies authorized amounts of certain fees & charges; authorizes borrower to rescind installment loan within specified period; requires licensee to refund or credit borrower certain charges under specified conditions; prohibits licensee from making payments to person as reward for referring loan applications to licensee.

527.title: Employment Opportunities for Persons with Disabilities
527.description: Provides legislative findings & purpose; requires specified state agencies & organizations to develop & implement interagency cooperative agreement for certain purposes.

528.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
528.title: Insurer Solvency
528.description: Revises surplus requirements for insurers when applying for or renewing a certificate of authority & for HMOs at all times; revises term "life & health insurer" to include specified HMOs & prepaid limited health service organizations; revises reporting requirements for certain insurers; revises reporting requirements of certain insurers; provides that HMOs are insurers for certain purposes; revises OIR examination authority; repeals provisions relating to payment of dividends & distributions of other property by HMOs; provides directive to DOLRI.

529.last_action: Veto Message received (2015 Special Session A)
529.title: Operations of the Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
529.description: Specifies that consumer representative appointed by Governor to corporation's board of governors is not prohibited from practicing in certain professions; authorizes use of certain policyholder information by private insurers in analyzing risks; prohibits use of information to directly solicit policyholders; requires policyholder, after date certain, to receive certain information related to demonstrations of interest by insurers; allows policyholder to elect to limit frequency of solicitations for take-out offers; provides circumstances under which policyholder whose policy was taken out to be considered renewal policyholder.

531.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7055 (Ch. 2015-163)
531.title: Military Affairs
531.description: Requires application form for original, renewal, or replacement driver license or identification card to include voluntary checkoff permitting veterans to request written information for federal, state, & local programs; directs DHSMV to report veteran information to DVA; directs DVA to disseminate veteran information to county or city veteran service officers & third-party provider; prohibits third-party provider from selling veteran information; creates Overseas Military Voting Assistance Task Force; requires Division of Elections to provide support staff to task force & Agency for State Technology to assist task force upon request; requires Secretary of State to submit report to Governor & Legislature containing task force recommendations for development & implementation of online voting system; provides for SBE & BOG to work collaboratively to align existing degree programs at state universities & Florida College System institutions, train faculty, coordinate campus disability services, facilitate statewide meetings for personnel, & provide sufficient courses & priority registration to veterans.

533.last_action: Died in Military and Veterans Affairs, Space, and Domestic Security
533.title: Discounts on Public Park Entrance Fees & Transportation Fares
533.description: Requires counties & municipalities to provide discounts on public park entrance fees to military members, veterans, & spouses & parents of certain deceased military members, law enforcement officers, firefighters, & emergency workers; requires regional transportation authorities to provide discounts on fares & charges to certain disabled veterans; defines "park entrance fees."

534.title: Pub. Rec./Medical Marijuana Patient Registry
534.description: Exempts from public records requirements personal identifying information of patients & physicians held by DOH in electronic medical marijuana patient registry; exempts information related to ordering & dispensing medical marijuana; authorizes specified persons & entities access to exempt information; requires that information released from registry remain confidential; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

535.title: Dropout Prevention
535.description: Creates Pay-for-Success Contract Program; provides that SBE may enter into contracts with certain entities to create dropout prevention programs for high-risk students; provides duties of SBE, contract requirements, dropout prevention program requirements, reporting requirements, & rulemaking; authorizes estimate of certain costs to state.

536.title: Central Florida Expressway Authority
536.description: Revises provisions for appointments to governing body of authority; specifies end of terms of members appointed by Governor; removes requirement that authority elect one of its members as secretary; specifies that Central Florida Expressway Authority is party to lease-purchase agreement between department & Orlando-Orange County Expressway Authority; removes requirement that title to former Orlando-Orange County Expressway System be transferred to state.

537.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 439 (Ch. 2015-92)
537.title: Patent Infringement
537.description: Creates "Patent Troll Prevention Act"; prohibits bad faith assertions of patent infringement from being made; provides factors that courts may consider when determining whether allegation was or was not made in bad faith; authorizes courts to require patent infringement plaintiff to post bond under certain circumstances; limits bond amount; authorizes courts to waive bond requirement in certain circumstances; authorizes private rights of action for violations; authorizes courts to award certain relief to prevailing plaintiffs; provides exemptions.

538.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
538.title: Intimate Apparel
538.description: Prohibits retail stores from allowing customer to try on intimate apparel in store unless over clothing or disposable shield; prohibits sale of intimate apparel that is tried on in violation of prohibition; defines term "intimate apparel."

539.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
539.title: Food Deserts Bill
539.description: Establishes food desert business tax credit for businesses that sell specific nutrient-dense food items; establishes amount of credit; provides procedures for claiming tax credit; requires review & recommendations of tax credit; provides penalties for fraudulent claims.

540.title: Compensation for Personal Injury or Wrongful Death Arising from a Medical Injury
540.description: Provides exclusive remedy for personal injury or wrongful death arising from medical injury; provides exceptions; creates Patient Compensation System; provides for various offices & committees; provides for independent medical review panels; prohibits certain conflicts of interest; provides process for filing application; provides for disposition of application; provides for determination of compensation when there is sufficient proof of medical injury; provides that compensation shall be offset by past & future collateral source payments; provides for determinations of malpractice for purposes of specified constitutional provision; provides for review of appeals by administrative law judge; requires annual contributions from specified providers; provides for provider opt out; requires annual report.

541.title: Trust Funds/Creation/Patient Compensation System Trust Fund/DOH
541.description: Creates Patient Compensation System Trust Fund within State Treasury; provides for purpose of trust fund; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides for contingent effect.

542.title: Terroristic Threats
542.description: Provides that person commits crime of terroristic threats if he or she communicates threat to do specified acts; requires that person convicted of terroristic threats pay restitution in amount equal to cost of evacuation; provides that order of restitution does not preclude relief recovery in civil action.

543.title: Cold Case Task Force
543.description: Creates task force within FDLE; specifies membership; prescribes duties; requires task force report to Governor & Legislature by specified date.

544.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
544.title: Driving Under the Influence
544.description: Authorizes court to order transdermal monitoring device or treatment program in lieu of ignition interlock device.

545.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
545.title: Contact Lens Pricing Practices
545.description: Prohibits certain acts by manufacturers of prescription contact lenses relating to retail sale, advertising, pricing, & distribution of contact lenses; prohibits use of contact lens distributor for certain purposes; provides for enforcement under Florida Deceptive & Unfair Trade Practices Act.

547.last_action: Died in Transportation and Ports Subcommittee
547.title: Railroad Walkways
547.description: Requires railroad companies to provide walkways adjacent to certain sections of tracks.

548.title: Disposition of Liens & Forfeited Property
548.description: Removes option of seizing agency to retain or profit from certain seized property; authorizes seizing agency to salvage, trade, or transfer property to certain governmental entities; authorizes seizing agency to purchase or bid on certain seized property offered for sale or auction; deletes provisions governing distribution of proceeds & use of property seized by local governmental agencies; requires governing body of municipality to expend or donate certain amounts of seized property to specified programs; provides requirements for application and approval of such donations; eliminates authority of law enforcement agencies to make determinations regarding funding of programs; eliminates exceptions for certain agencies relating to deposit of proceeds from seizures.

549.title: Insurance Fraud
549.description: Repeals provisions relating to operation or reporting of unlicensed health care clinics; revises provisions related to certain health care clinic charges or reimbursement claims; revises & provides criminal penalties for unlawful charges, operating or failing to report unlicensed clinic, filing false or misleading information related to clinic license application, & other violations; repeals provisions relating to establishment of motor vehicle insurance fraud DSO.

550.title: Contraband Forfeiture
550.description: Requires that seizure or forfeiture of property be incidental to arrest under Florida Contraband Forfeiture Act.

551.title: Division of Insurance Agent and Agency Services
551.description: Revises definition of "general lines" agent; revises & creates licensure & examination requirements for general lines agent, personal lines agent, all-lines adjuster, life agent & health agent; revises prelicensure education requirements for insurance agents; revises qualifications for a customer representative's license; requires agents to maintain certain records for specified periods; defines "surrender"; authorizes certain notices of insolvency to be delivered by e-mail.

552.title: Expunction of Criminal History Records
552.description: Requires automatic expunction of certain criminal history records upon restoration of civil rights; provides exceptions & procedures; provides for effect of expunction & treatment of certain statutory cross-references.

553.title: Pub. Rec./Automatically Expunged Criminal Records
553.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for criminal history records that are automatically expunged upon restoration of person's civil rights; provides exception; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption under OGSRA; provides statement of public necessity.

555.last_action: Died in Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
555.title: Natural Gas Rebate Program
555.description: Authorizing the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services to receive additional applications from certain applicants; authorizing any remaining unencumbered funds to be used by the department to award additional rebates, etc.

556.title: Imitation Firearms
556.description: Prohibits person, for commercial purposes, from knowingly selling imitation firearm after specified date; provides exceptions; prohibits person on or after specified date from knowingly altering, changing, removing, or obliterating certain features required by law for an imitation firearm; prohibits person on or after specified date from knowingly adding certain features that make firearm look more like an imitation firearm; provides exceptions; prohibits person from knowingly displaying or exposing an imitation firearm in public place after specified date; provides exceptions; requires that any imitation firearm manufactured after certain date be accompanied by conspicuous written advisory containing specified information as part of packaging; authorizes conspicuous advisory to be affixed to imitation firearm.

558.title: Honor and Remember Flag
558.description: Designates Honor & Remember flag as emblem of state; authorizes that flag be displayed at specified locations, on specified days, & in specified manner; requires displayed flags to be manufactured in United States; authorizes local governments to display flag.

559.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
559.title: Exceptional Student Education
559.description: Defines "dyslexia"; provides that parents of students with learning disabilities are entitled to same notice & due process as parents of students with other disabilities; provides for development of IEP team &, if appropriate, an IEP; exempts certain students from excess hour surcharge for college credit hours exceeding baccalaureate degree program requirements.

560.title: Residential Master Building Permit Programs
560.description: Requires local governments, if requested by certain contractors, to create master building permit programs by specified date to assist builders who expect to construct specific dwellings & townhomes repeatedly; provides requirements for submitting master building permit applications, general construction plans, & site-specific building permit applications; authorizes builders to submit master building permit numbers unlimited number of times under certain conditions; limits revisions to approved master building permits; requires governing body of applicable local government to set fees; provides for penalties; authorizes local governments to adopt procedures to effectuate master building permit programs.

561.title: Vocational Rehabilitation
561.description: Requires Workforce Florida, Inc., to include measurable performance goals for employment of persons who have a disability in a state strategic plan.

562.title: Special Districts
562.description: Authorizes creation of special districts by special act; requires new special districts & authorizes existing districts to identify their district as independent or dependent in certain documents; revises required content of special district handbook; authorizes local governments to review certain special districts; revises list of items required to be included on special district websites & time needed to remain on websites.

563.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
563.title: John M. McKay Scholarships for Students with Disabilities Program
