563.description: Requires parent of certain students to acknowledge receipt of information relating to John M. McKay Scholarships; requires school district to keep acknowledgment & annually provide acknowledgment to DOE; authorizes DOE to create standard acknowledgment form; requires school districts to use standard acknowledgment form if provided by DOE.

564.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1216 (Ch. 2015-30)
564.title: Connected-City Corridors
564.description: Provides that connected-city corridor plan amendments are to be reviewed by local governments only; authorizes local governments to adopt connected-city corridor plan amendments; provides requirements for plan amendments; authorizes affected persons to file petition with DOAH for review of plan amendments; provides exemption from DRI review process for developments within geographic boundaries of connected-city corridor plan.

566.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
566.title: City of Tallahassee, Leon County
566.description: Revises boundaries of downtown area for purposes of temporary permits to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises at outdoor events on public right-of-way in downtown area of Tallahassee.

567.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
567.title: City of Lauderhill, Broward County
567.description: Provides conditions under which neighborhood improvement district may borrow money contract loans, & issue bonds, certificates, warrants, notes, or other evidence of indebtedness & may pledge special assessment power of district to pay such debts for purpose of financing certain capital projects.

568.title: City of West Palm Beach, Palm Beach County
568.description: Revises provisions relating to West Palm Beach Firefighters Pension Fund.

569.title: Staffing Ratios in Health Care Facilities
569.description: Designates act as "Florida Hospital Patient Protection Act"; requires minimum staffing levels of direct care registered nurses in health care facility; prohibits facility from imposing mandatory overtime; specifies required ratios of direct care registered nurses to patients; prohibits health care facility from using video cameras or monitors as substitutes for required level of care; requires annual evaluation of staffing levels; requires AHCA to develop uniform standards for nurse staffing requirements; prohibits health care facility from assigning unlicensed personnel to perform functions of licensed or registered nurse; authorizes direct care registered nurse to assign activities to other nursing staff; provides that direct care registered nurse has right of action against facility that violates provisions of act; prohibits facility from interfering with nurses' right to organize or bargain collectively; authorizes agency to impose fines.

570.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
570.title: Water and Wastewater
570.description: Requires Division of Bond Finance to review certain private activity bonds; exempts sales & leases to certain water utilities from sales tax; exempts from regulation person who resells water to certain entities;

571.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
571.title: Constrained Agricultural Parcels
571.description: Authorizes landowners of constrained parcels to seek amendment to local government comprehensive plan; provides timeframe for local government & landowner to agree to schedule & to negotiate consensus on consistency of uses, densities, & intensities; establishes presumption that amendment is not urban sprawl under certain circumstances; requires local government to transmit amendment to state land planning agency for review; limits local government's authority to establish specified prohibitions on constrained parcels; exempts specified property.

572.last_action: Died in K-12 Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7069 (Ch. 2015-6)
572.title: Education Accountability
572.description: Provides that English Language Arts (ELA) & Mathematics online assessments may not be fully implemented until certain technology infrastructure, connectivity, & capacity have been tested, verified, & certified as ready; specifies that, for purpose of student assessment program, state & local student assessment programs must use minimum amount of testing necessary; provides that PSAT, SAT, & ACT are tests that may be accepted in lieu of common placement test to assess student college readiness; revising personnel evaluation procedures & criteria, including student learning assessments.

573.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee
573.title: Community-Based Care Lead Agencies
573.description: Provides additional eligibility requirements for child to remain in licensed care; provides additional grounds for termination of eligibility for young adult in extended foster care; provides additional factors for court consideration in reviewing young adult's status in care; provides for portability of services; provides additional criteria for determination of eligibility & priority for receipt of waiver services; revises Road-to-Independence Program; revises eligibility requirements for postsecondary education services & support, financial assistance, & aftercare services.

574.title: Pari-Mutuel Permitholders
574.description: Revises provisions relating to licensing of greyhound racing permitholders; revises provisions for fees, taxes & tax credits, intertrack wagering, greyhound adoption, charity racing days, live racing requirements, slot machine gaming areas, & cardroom licenses.

575.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
575.title: Florida Healthy Working Families Act
575.description: Creates "Florida Healthy Working Families Act"; provides powers & duties of executive director of DEO; provides applicability; requires certain employers to provide employees with earned sick & safe leave under certain conditions; provides employer & employee requirements; authorizes employee to file civil action under certain conditions; provides penalties.

576.title: State Lotteries
576.description: Requires Department of Lottery to place in escrow the prize of person convicted of certain criminal acts or person owing certain debts subject to resolution of claims; requires appropriate state agency & judicial branch to notify DOL of specified criminal convictions.

578.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
578.title: Minority Business Status for Disabled Persons
578.description: Revises definition of term "minority person" to include disabled persons for purposes of Florida Small & Minority Business Assistance Act.

579.last_action: Died in Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
579.title: Services for Combat Veterans and Their Families
579.description: Requires DCF to establish Florida Combat Veterans' Care Coordination Program to provide combat veterans & their families with behavioral healthcare referral & care coordination services & to contract with managing entities to enter into agreements with Florida 211 Network participants for such services; provides for delivery of services by program teams; requires Florida 211 Network participants to submit certain information to DCF; requires DCF to submit report to Governor & Legislature; provides appropriation.

580.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
580.title: Interpreters for Persons who are Deaf or Hard of Hearing
580.description: Creates Board of Interpreters for Deaf and Hard of Hearing; requires interpreter to apply for license or permit by specified date; requires DBPR to issue licenses, permits, or provisional permits; requires background checks; provides continuing education requirements; requires interpreting agency to register with DBPR; requires individual to elect active or inactive status at time of license or permit renewal; requires DBPR to charge fees; authorizes board to earmark specific amount from such fees; authorizes Legislature to appropriate excess funds; prohibits certain actions by individuals & entities; authorizes board to discipline individuals; requires board & DBPR to adopt rules.

581.title: Civil Remedies Against Insurers
581.description: Requires insureds, claimants, or persons acting on their behalf to provide insurer with written notice of loss as condition precedent to statutory or common-law action for third-party bad-faith failure to settle insurance claim; provides that insurer is not liable for claim of bad-faith failure to settle claim if certain conditions met.

582.title: Damages in Personal Injury Actions
582.description: Provides for calculation of damages; specifies that certain evidence may not be used for certain purposes; provides that difference between amount originally billed by health care provider who has provided medical or health care services to claimant & actual amount remitted to provider is not recoverable; limits amount of damages in certain actions involving liens or subrogation claims by certain payors.

583.title: Ocean Highway and Port Authority, Nassau County
583.description: Provides for partisan election of members of board of port commissioners.

584.title: Cedar Hammock Fire Control District
584.description: Revises boundaries; provides for five-member board; provides for ad valorem assessments & non-ad valorem assessments, & impact fees; deletes schedule of non-ad valorem assessments.

585.title: Regulation of Oil and Gas Resources
585.description: Requiring that a permit be obtained before the performance of a high-pressure well stimulation; prohibiting the department from approving permits for high-pressure well stimulation until certain rulemaking is complete; directing the department to conduct a study on high-pressure well stimulation; requiring the department to designate the national chemical registry as the state's registry, etc.

586.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
586.title: Trust Funds/Creation/Environmental Rapid Response Trust Fund/DEP
586.description: Creates Environmental Rapid Response Trust Fund within DEP; provides for purpose & source of trust fund; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides contingent effective date.

587.title: Pub. Rec./High-Pressure Well Stimulation Chemical Disclosure Registry
587.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for proprietary business information contained within information relating to high-pressure well stimulations obtained by DEP in connection with DEP's online high-pressure well stimulation chemical disclosure registry; provides procedures & requirements with respect to granting of confidential & exempt status; provides for disclosure under specified circumstances; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

588.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 791 (Ch. 2015-97)
588.title: Community Associations
588.description: Authorizes electronic transmission of notices of certain meetings of condominium, cooperative, or homeowners' association irrespective of whether authorized by association's bylaws; authorizes condominium, cooperative, & homeowners' associations to conduct votes of membership by online voting under certain conditions; provides that member voting electronically is counted toward determination of quorum; provides applicability.

589.title: West Palm Beach Water Catchment Area, Palm Beach County

590.title: Alachua County
590.description: Repeals Alachua County Boundary Adjustment Act, including provisions for establishing municipal reserve areas & adjusting boundaries of municipalities within county through annexations or contractions of corporate limits.

591.title: Hillsborough River Technical Advisory Council, Hillsborough County
591.description: Revises membership of council; revises appointing authorities & terms of council members; provides for designation of alternates.

592.title: Public Food Service Establishments
592.description: Revises definition of term "public food service establishment" to exclude certain events; provides additional requirements for temporary food service event sponsors.

594.last_action: Died in Veteran and Military Affairs Subcommittee
594.title: Florida Foreclosed Homes for the Brave Program
594.description: Directs Department of Veterans' Affairs, in coordination with Building Homes for Heroes, to purchase foreclosed homes for eligible injured veterans of U.S. Armed Forces; authorizes program to provide specified types of assistance; provides eligibility criteria; requires review of financial transactions of program; authorizes department to adopt rules to administer program; provides appropriation.

595.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
595.title: Guardianship
595.description: Reorganizes provisions in ch. 744, F.S.; revises responsibilities of executive director for Office of Public & Professional Guardians; removes authority of executive director to suspend or revoke registration of guardian who commits certain violations & requirement of written notification to chief judge upon such action; requires office to adopt rules & make specified recommendation to court; requires that professional guardian appointed to represent ward be selected from registry of professional guardians; requires chief judge of circuit court to compile list of professional guardians; provides requirements for inclusion in registry; provides procedures to appoint professional guardian; provides Office of Public and Professional Guardians with access to records relating to guardianship cases for which professional guardian is appointed.

597.title: State Employee Salaries
597.description: Designates act as "State Employee Fairness Act"; provides competitive pay adjustment for state employees; requires appropriation.

598.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
598.title: Pinellas County
598.description: Updates terminology applicable to provisions relating to Pinellas Police Standards Council; revises certain assessments of court costs that provide funding for council.

599.title: Gaming
599.description: Revises provisions relating to pari-mutuel wagering operating licenses, live racing requirements, transfer and conversion and relocation of permits, summer jai alai permits, tax on handle, tax credits, escheated permits, purse requirements, daily license fees & unclaimed tickets & breaks, greyhound adoption, racing days, nonwagering equine competitions, greyhound injury reporting, out-of-state races, intertrack wagering, slot machine gaming licenses, cardroom licenses & operations; provides for vote on question of authorizing destination resorts.

600.title: Pub. Rec./Department of Gaming Control
600.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for confidential & proprietary business information & trade secrets received by Department of Gaming Control; provides exemption from public records requirements for information held that would reveal investigation techniques & procedures used by department; provides for review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

601.title: Trust Funds/Creation/Destination Resort Trust Fund/Department of Gaming Control
601.description: Creates Destination Resort Trust Fund within Department of Gaming Control; provides for contingent effect.

602.last_action: Died in K-12 Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7069 (Ch. 2015-6)
602.title: School Personnel Evaluations
602.description: Requires instructional personnel & school administrator performance evaluations to include certain criteria; revises percentage of evaluation based on performance of students, & method & data used & approval process for measurement of student learning growth in evaluations; revises rulemaking authority; revises percentage of classroom teacher's or school administrator's performance evaluation based on performance of students.

604.title: Music Therapists
604.description: Establishes music therapist profession within Division of Medical Quality Assurance of DOH; creates Music Therapy Advisory Committee; provides for membership & terms of members; establishes requirements for licensure as music therapist; provides application requirements; requires certain fees to be deposited into Medical Quality Assurance Trust Fund; establishes license renewal process; provides for disciplinary grounds & actions; authorizes investigations by division for allegations of misconduct.

607.title: School District of Palm Beach County
607.description: Allows district to install signs recognizing business partnerships.

608.title: Lehigh Acres Municipal Services Improvement District, Lee and Hendry Counties
608.description: Creates Lehigh Acres Municipal Services Improvement District; provides charter; dissolves East County Water Control District; prohibits annexation.

609.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
609.title: Bail Bonds
609.description: Requires that person complete specified periods of licensure before being eligible for ownership of or other pecuniary interest in bail bond agency; revises eligibility requirements for bail bond agent applicants; provides requirements for primary bail bond agents; revises restrictions on where & how bail bond agents & agencies may solicit business; provides for fine & license suspension for violations of specified licensing provisions & for fine & license revocation for second offense; provides requirements for relicensure; clarifies provisions relating to commitment of bail bond agent; provides circumstances under which, while on bond, a breach of bail bond conditions occurs; revises conditions under which forfeiture must be discharged; revises provisions relating to remission of forfeiture.

610.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
610.title: Discretionary Sales Surtaxes
610.description: Authorizes county to use proceeds & interest of local government infrastructure surtax to maintain transportation infrastructure under specified circumstances.

611.title: Criminal Offenders
611.description: Requires Department of the Lottery to verify whether certain prize claimants owe debts relating to registration as specified types of offenders; provides additional mandatory term of incarceration for specified offenses committed by sexual offenders & predators; authorizes sheriffs to assess fees for registering & reregistering specified types of offenders subject to registration requirements; specifies maximum fees; provides requirements for use of fees; provides for relocation of registrants; provides enhanced criminal penalties for repeat violations of provisions prohibiting forcing another into prostitution; provides criminal penalties for first offense of sexting; requires persons convicted of specified prostitution related offenses to register as sexual offenders; prohibits failure to pay required fees; provides additional conditions for sex offender probation & community control for certain offenders & controlees who commit qualifying offenses after specified date; provides that such conditions do not need to be pronounced orally at time of sentencing; provides that such conditions may be applied to other relevant offenders; requires supervision by DOC officers who have specified training & limited caseloads.

612.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
612.title: Homeowners' Associations
612.description: Authorizes local governing authority to enforce deed restrictions on certain property that is not part of homeowners' association; provides reporting requirements for community association manager, management firm, & association; authorizes department to arbitrate certain homeowners' association-related disputes at its discretion; authorizes mediator or arbitrator to conduct mediation or arbitration only if he or she has been certified; requires DBPR to provide training & educational programs for homeowners' association members, directors, & officers; authorizes department to enforce & ensure compliance with certain provisions and rules; provides that department has complete jurisdiction to investigate complaints relating to homeowners' associations; provides limitation on certain homeowner fees for transfer of title.

613.title: Emergency Medical Air Transportation Services
613.description: Requires additional penalty to be imposed for certain moving violations; provides for distribution & use of moneys received; directs DOH to establish separate account within Emergency Medical Services Trust Fund; requires certain fees to be deposited in account to be used for specified purposes; provides conditions for increasing reimbursement for emergency medical air transportation services providers.

614.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 290 (Ch. 2015-44)
614.title: Carrying a Concealed Weapon or a Concealed Firearm
614.description: Provides legislative intent regarding justifiable use of force; clarifies what constitutes provocation in determination of applicability of justified use of force; provides exemption from criminal penalties for person carrying concealed weapon or concealed firearm when evacuating pursuant to mandatory evacuation order during declared state of emergency; reenacts offense severity ranking chart.

618.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
618.title: Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund
618.description: Revises definition of term "retention"; revises requirements for calculation of insurer's retention; revises requirements for reimbursement contracts.

619.title: Inspectors General
619.description: Requires Chief Inspector General to publish final investigative reports on EOG's website within specified period; requires agency inspector general to publish final investigative reports on agency's website within specified period; provides definition; requires unit of local government or county, if unit of local government does not have official website, to publish final investigative reports on its website within specified period; specifies when investigative report becomes final.

620.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 716 (Ch. 2015-62)
620.title: Public Records/Veterinary Medical Practice
620.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for medical records related to medical condition & treatment of animal by accredited state college of veterinary medicine & for records transferred by previous records owner in connection with specified transactions; authorizes certain disclosure of such information; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

621.last_action: Died in Children, Families and Seniors Subcommittee
621.title: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services
621.description: Revises DCF continuity of care system to provide supportive services; requires county intake agencies to use electronic shared information platform for community referrals; requires contracts to include additional information; revises legislative intent with respect to provision of substance abuse & mental health services.

622.title: Implementation of Water and Land Conservation Constitutional Amendment
622.description: Terminates obsolete trust funds & provides for disposition of balances; revises distributions of documentary stamp tax revenues into certain trust funds; revises distributions of revenues upon sale of certain lands; reenacts the Land Acquisition Trust Fund; deletes obsolete provisions relating to use of bond & trust fund proceeds; conforms provisions.

623.title: Trust Funds/Creation/Land Acquisition Trust Fund/DOS
623.description: Creates Land Acquisition Trust Fund within DOS; identifies purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for transfer of moneys to trust fund within DEP under certain circumstances; provides for future review of trust fund.

624.title: Trust Funds/Creation/Land Acquisition Trust Fund/DACS
624.description: Creates Land Acquisition Trust Fund within DACS; identifies purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for transfer of moneys to trust fund within DEP under certain circumstances; provides for future review of trust fund.

625.title: Recreational Marijuana
625.description: Imposes excise tax on recreational marijuana; exempts certain activities involving marijuana from use & possession offenses; authorizes persons age 21 & over to engage in certain activities involving personal use of marijuana in limited amounts; provides limits on where persons may engage in specified activities; provides for licensure of marijuana establishments that may engage in manufacture, possession or purchase of marijuana, marijuana products & marijuana accessories or sell marijuana, marijuana products or marijuana accessories to consumer; provides for enforcement; provides for limits on number of retail marijuana stores in localities based on population; provides standards for prospective licensees; provides restrictions on location of marijuana establishments; prohibits certain activities by marijuana establishments; authorizes localities to prohibit one or more types of marijuana establishments; provides an exemption from specified provisions for marijuana research.

626.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
626.title: Community Inclusion and Life Transition Advisory Councils
626.description: Creates the Community Inclusion and Life Transition Advisory Councils; provides for legislative intent, administrative housing in DOE, composition of councils, duties & responsibilities, reporting requirements, & per diem & reimbursement of members.

627.title: Juvenile Sentencing
627.description: Makes provisions relating to life sentences for certain juvenile offenders applicable to offenses committed before July 1, 2014.

628.title: Racial and Ethnic Impacts
628.description: Requires presentation of minority correctional impact statement before floor debate of certain legislation affecting criminal offenses or penalties; provides requirements for such statement; requires state agency that awards grants to include with each grant application racial & ethnic impact statement; provides that statement may only be used for informational purposes; limits requirement to grants awarded to entities other than natural persons.

629.last_action: Veto Message received (2015 Special Session A)
629.title: Home Medical Equipment Providers
629.description: Exempts allopathic, osteopathic, & chiropractic physicians who sell or rent electrostimulation medical equipment from licensure requirements under certain circumstances.

630.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
630.title: Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
630.description: Revises definition of term "covered policy"; exempts additional specified activities of corporation from certain requirements; revises requirements relating to quota share primary insurance agreements; requires corporation's plan of operation to adopt program that facilitates removal of certain residential risks; specifies limitations on participation in such program; deletes & revises related terms; provides that entering into specified agreements is at discretion of insurer; provides that if corporation is reinsurer, all forms & endorsements must be approved by OIR; prohibits corporation from sharing risk for certain damages; requires corporation & each insurer to report additional information to fund & requires SBA to adopt rules to administer such requirement; revises procedures for determining whether risk is eligible for corporation.

631.title: Publicly Funded Retirement Plans
631.description: Requires that actuarial reports for certain retirement plans include mortality tables; specifies requirements; revises information to be included in defined benefit system or plan's annual report to DMS; provides declaration of important state interest; provides effective dates.

632.title: CPR Training in Public Schools
632.description: Requires school districts to provide training in CPR to students; requires students to study & practice psychomotor skills associated with performing CPR at least once before graduating from high school; provides exception for students who have disability.

633.last_action: Died in Highway and Waterway Safety Subcommittee
633.title: Use of Wireless Communications Devices While Driving
633.description: Prohibits use of handheld cellular telephones & other handheld electronic communications devices by drivers.

634.title: Florida Ethics Center
634.description: Creates Florida Ethics Center within Office of Chief Inspector General in EOG; establishes mission & duties of center; requires center to be located in Capitol Complex; provides for appropriations.

635.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
635.title: Exemption from Sales & Use Tax for College Textbooks
635.description: Exempts sale of certain textbooks from sales & use tax.

636.last_action: Died in Local Government Affairs Subcommittee
636.title: Tierra Verde Fire Control District, Pinellas County
636.description: Creates district; provides charter; requires referendum.

637.title: Gainesville Regional Utilities Commission, Alachua County
637.description: Creates the Gainesville Regional Utilities Commission; requires referendum.

638.title: City of Holmes Beach, Manatee County
638.description: Revises city's municipal boundaries to include unincorporated submerged lands; requires city to apply specified county codes & Florida Building Code to construction, installation, & placement of certain infrastructure & other resources previously under county's jurisdiction.

639.title: City of Winter Park, Orange County
639.description: Repeals provisions relating to alcoholic beverage license exemptions within city.

640.title: Immokalee Water and Sewer District, Collier County
640.description: Provides compensation for members of district's board of commissioners.

641.title: Firefighters' Relief and Pension Fund of the City of Pensacola, Escambia County
641.description: Adds optional benefits; provides required minimum distributions; provides for retirement after 10 years of service; provides death benefits, additional benefits, & protection of benefits; provides maximum pension; provides for plan termination; provides for forfeitures.

642.title: Emergency Medical Services Authority, Pinellas County
642.description: Revises membership & terms of office of members of governing body of authority.

643.title: Pinellas County/Alcoholic Beverage Temporary Permits
643.description: Authorizes DBPR's Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco to issue up to specified number of temporary permits to nonprofit civic organization to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises within special event permitted area designated by incorporated municipality; provides that such permits are in addition to certain other temporary permits; requires nonprofit civic organization to comply with certain provisions in obtaining permits.

645.title: Death Penalty
645.description: Deletes provisions providing for death penalty for capital felonies; deletes associated provisions, including provisions relating to representation in death penalty cases, capital collateral representation, jurors in capital cases, prohibiting imposition of death sentence on defendant with mental retardation, determination of whether to impose sentence of death or life imprisonment for capital felony or capital drug trafficking felony, issuance of warrant of execution, stay of execution of death sentence, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be insane, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be pregnant, grounds for death warrant, execution of death sentence, prohibition against reduction of death sentence as result of determination that method of execution is unconstitutional, sentencing orders in capital cases, regulation of execution, transfer to state prison for safekeeping before death warrant issued, return of warrant of execution issued by Governor, sentence of death unexecuted for unjustifiable reasons, & return of warrant of execution issued by Supreme Court.

646.title: Licenses to Carry Concealed Weapons or Firearms
646.description: Deletes provision prohibiting concealed carry licensees from openly carrying handgun or carrying concealed weapon or firearm into college or university facility.

647.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 522 (Ch. 2015-22)
647.title: Division of Bond Finance
647.description: Deletes requirement that Division of Bond Finance issue newsletter addressing local & state bonds.

650.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
650.title: Workforce Education Postsecondary Student Fees
650.description: Removes adult general education program student fees.

651.last_action: Died in Business and Professions Subcommittee
651.title: Public Lodging Establishments & Public Food Service Establishments
651.description: Deletes provisions that preempt to state the regulation of public lodging establishments & public food service establishments; conforms provisions to changes made by act.

652.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 450 (Ch. 2015-49)
652.title: Pain-Management Clinics
652.description: Deletes expiration of provisions related to registration & regulation of pain-management clinics.

653.title: Use of Force
653.description: Deletes provisions specifying that person has no duty to retreat & has right to stand his or her ground & meet force with force in certain circumstances.

654.title: Financial Reporting
654.description: Deletes provisions with respect to preparation by certain condominium associations, cooperative associations, & homeowners' associations of annual reports of cash receipts & expenditures.

655.title: Slungshot
655.description: Deletes provisions prohibiting manufacture or sale of any instrument or weapon usually known as slungshot; revises definition of term "concealed weapon" to delete inclusion of slungshot; deletes provision prohibiting dealer in arms from selling or transferring slungshot to minor.

656.title: Traffic Infraction Detectors
656.description: Repeals provisions relating to installation & use of traffic infraction detectors to enforce specified provisions when driver fails to stop at traffic signal.

657.title: Use of Deadly Force in Defense of a Person
657.description: Repeals provisions relating to home protection & use of deadly force, which created presumption of fear of death or great bodily harm in certain circumstances & provided that person has no duty to retreat & has right to stand his or her ground & meet force with force in certain circumstances; conforms provisions.

658.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
658.title: Postsecondary Education Fee Waivers
658.description: Deletes provisions relating to the out-of-state fee waiver for students meeting certain attendance, graduation, & enrollment requirements.

659.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
659.title: Student Fee Exemptions
659.description: Deletes exemption from payment of tuition & fees at school districts that provide workforce education programs & public postsecondary educational institutions for certain students who lack regular nighttime residence or sleeping accommodation.

660.title: Admission of Attorneys to Practice Law
660.description: Deletes provision authorizing Supreme Court to admit bar applicant who is unauthorized immigrant in certain circumstances.

661.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
661.title: Industrial Machinery & Equipment Sales Tax Exemption
661.description: Removes scheduled repeal of sales & use tax exemption for industrial machinery & equipment purchased by certain manufacturing businesses.

662.title: Marriage/Issuance of Marriage Licenses to Persons of the Same Sex
662.description: Deletes requirement that marriage license only be issued to one male & one female; deletes provision specifying that term "marriage" in statute or rule means only legal union between one man & one woman as husband & wife & that term "spouse" applies only to member of such union.

663.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
663.title: Public Records and Public Meetings/University Direct-Support Organizations
663.description: Deletes provision that protects identity of donor to university direct-support organization; deletes public records exemption for university direct-support organization; deletes public meetings exemption for certain meetings of university direct-support organization.

664.title: Cannabis
664.description: Removes cannabis from schedule of controlled substances; conforms provisions.

665.title: Write-in Candidates
665.description: Repeals requirement that write-in candidate reside within district represented by office sought at time of qualification.

666.title: Repeal of a Prohibition on Cohabitation
666.description: Deletes provisions prohibiting cohabitation by unmarried men & women.

667.title: Regulation of Firearms and Ammunition
667.description: Repeals provisions relating to preemption of field of regulation of firearms & ammunition to state & providing exceptions; conforms provisions.

668.title: Lewd and Lascivious Behavior
668.description: Repeals prohibition on lewd & lascivious behavior, including prohibition on lewd & lascivious association & cohabitation together by man & woman who are not married to each other; conforms provisions.

669.title: General Appropriations Act
669.description: Provides moneys for annual period beginning July 1, 2015, & ending June 30, 2016, & supplemental appropriations for period ending June 30, 2015, to pay salaries & other expenses, capital outlay-buildings & other improvements, & for other specified purposes of various agencies of state government.

670.title: Implementing the 2015-2016 General Appropriations Act
670.description: Implements specific appropriations of the General Appropriations Act for the 2015-2016 fiscal year.

671.title: State-Administered Retirement Systems
671.description: Increases employer contribution to retiree health insurance subsidy for members of state-administered plan; increases employer contribution to health insurance subsidy for members of Elected Officers' Class; increases employer contribution to health insurance subsidy for members of Senior Management Service Class; increases employer contribution to health insurance subsidy for members of Regular, Special Risk, & Special Risk Administrative Support Classes; revises amount of employer contributions to FRS for 2015-2016 fiscal year; provides findings of important state interest.

672.title: Collective Bargaining
672.description: Provides for resolution of collective bargaining issues at impasse between State of Florida & certified bargaining units for state employees pursuant to specified instructions.

673.title: State Group Insurance Program
673.description: Authorizes state group insurance program to include high deductible plans; requires employees hired after specified date to participate in high-deductible plan; revises state's monthly contribution for certain employees under state group insurance program; specifies circumstances in which act does not take effect.

674.title: Florida Best and Brightest Teacher Scholarship Program
674.description: Establishes Florida Best & Brightest Teacher Scholarship Program within DOE; provides legislative intent; provides for funding, eligibility, & disbursement of funds; defines term "school district" for purposes of act.

675.title: Medicaid
675.description: Extends designation of certain hospitals as rural hospitals; removes community intermediate care facilities for developmentally disabled from statutory rate freeze; updates references to data used for calculating disproportionate share program payments to certain hospitals; provides for certain rebates to be placed in GRF unallocated; provides for deposit of contributions into Grants & Donations Trust Fund; repeals provisions relating to state & local Medicaid partnerships; removes requirement that AHCA support Healthy Start services with public expenditures & federal matching funds; specifies factors agency must consider to reconcile payments to long-term care managed care plans.

676.title: Department of Children and Families
676.description: Revises recurring core services funding for community-based care lead agencies; requires DCF to receive legislative authorization before seeking, applying for, accepting, or renewing any waiver of work requirements under SNAP.

677.title: Alzheimer's Disease Research
677.description: Provides for carryforward of unexpended balance of appropriation for Ed and Ethel Moore Alzheimer's Disease Research Program.

678.title: Juvenile Detention Costs
678.description: Revises provisions relating to state payments for costs of juveniles residing in fiscally constrained counties & out of state; deletes provisions relating to development & use of methodology for determining amount of each fiscally constrained county's costs of detention care; requires each nonfiscally constrained county to budget certain amount for costs of juvenile detention care; specifies duties of DJJ; provides for calculation of county contributions; deletes provisions relating to technical assistance to department; provides for review of county payments; provides certain assurances to holders of bonds issued by counties.

680.title: Florida Business Information Portal
680.description: Directs DBPR to implement Florida Business Information Portal; specifies contents of portal; requires state agencies to cooperate with DBPR to develop, implement, & update portal; requires DBPR to submit report to Governor & Legislature; specifies required elements of report; repeals provisions relating to One-Stop Business Registration Portal & terminates related trust fund within DOR.

682.title: Interception of Wire, Oral, or Electronic Communication
682.description: Authorizing a child younger than 18 years of age to intercept and record an oral communication if the child is a party to the communication and certain conditions are met, etc.

683.title: Water Resources
683.description: Revises provisions relating to water resource development; establishment & implementation of minimum flows & levels & total maximum daily loads; Central Florida Water Initiative; projects of South Florida Water Management District; preferred water supply sources; consumptive use permit applications; improvements on private agricultural lands; Northern Everglades & Estuaries Protection Program; power & duties of water management districts with regard to water production & water resource & supply development; regional water supply planning; springs & aquifer protection; surface water classification; & potable water supply.

684.title: OGSR/Commission for Independent Education
684.description: Removes scheduled repeal of exemptions from public records & public meeting requirements for records of investigations conducted by Commission for Independent Education, discussions of such investigatory records at probable cause panel meetings, & recordings, minutes, & findings from closed portions of such meetings.

685.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 620 (Ch. 2015-55)
685.title: Emergency Management
685.description: Exempts state employees from specified travel expense provisions when traveling under Emergency Management Assistance Compact pursuant to request for assistance from another state under certain circumstances.

686.title: Corporate Income Tax
686.description: Adopts 2015 version of Internal Revenue Code; incorporates reference to recent federal act into state law for purpose of defining "adjusted federal income"; revises treatment by this state of certain depreciation & expensing of assets that are allowed for federal income tax purposes; authorizes DOR to adopt emergency rules; provides retroactive applicability.

687.title: OGSR/Public Transit Providers
687.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for certain personal identifying information held by public transit providers.

688.title: Adoption and Foster Care
688.description: Revising requirements for agreements between the Department of Children and Families and specified entities for the provision of educational services; requiring the community-based care lead agency to contact by telephone the child's adoptive family within a specified period after the date that the adoption is finalized; authorizing a direct-support organization established by the Office of Adoption and Child Protection to accept donations of products or services from private sources to be given to the recipients of the adoption achievement awards; requiring licensed child-placing agencies that provide adoption services for intercountry adoptions to meet specified requirements.

690.title: Early Learning
690.description: Includes large family child care homes in local zoning regulation requirements; revises certain minimum standards for child care facilities & requirements for certain personnel; provides for inspection of programs regulated by DCF; provides exemptions from child care facility licensing standards; revises restrictions on residential property insurance coverage to include coverage for large family child care homes & Child Care Executive Partnership; provides OEL with authority to allocate certain funds.

691.title: Workforce Services
691.description: Renames Workforce Florida, Inc., as CareerSource Florida, Inc.; creates task force on preparation for state's implementation of federal Workforce Innovation & Opportunity Act; provides membership & duties of task force; requires task force to submit report & recommendations for approval by CareerSource Florida, Inc.; requires CareerSource Florida, Inc., to submit specified state plan to USDOL; provides for abolishment of task force.

692.title: Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission
692.description: Authorizing citizen support organizations to receive funds from the commission if the organization provides services by contract under certain circumstances; revising the time period for which tarpon tags are valid; removing criteria for issuance of restricted species endorsements on saltwater products licenses; removing provisions authorizing the commission to limit the number of participants engaged in the taking of alligators or their eggs; providing penalties for the feeding of wildlife and freshwater fish, etc.

695.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 700 (Ch. 2015-1)
695.title: Official Florida Statutes
695.description: Adopts Florida Statutes 2015 & designates portions thereof that are to constitute official law of state; provides that Florida Statutes 2015 shall be effective immediately upon publication; provides that general laws enacted during August 7-11, 2014, special session & prior thereto & not included in Florida Statutes 2015 are repealed; provides that general laws enacted during 2015 regular session are not repealed by this adoption act.

696.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 702 (Ch. 2015-2)
696.title: Florida Statutes/General
696.description: Deletes provisions that have expired, become obsolete, had their effect, served their purpose, or been impliedly repealed or superseded; replaces incorrect cross-references & citations; corrects grammatical, typographical, & like errors; removes inconsistencies, redundancies, & unnecessary repetition in statutes; improves clarity of statutes & facilitates their correct interpretation; confirms restoration of provisions unintentionally omitted from republication in acts of Legislature during amendatory process & removes gender-specific references applicable to human beings from Florida Statutes without substantive change in legal effect.

697.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 704 (Ch. 2015-3)
697.title: Florida Statutes/Noncurrent Repeal or Expiration
697.description: Repeals specified provisions that have become inoperative by noncurrent repeal or expiration & may be omitted from 2014 Florida Statutes only through reviser's bill duly enacted by Legislature.

698.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 706 (Ch. 2015-4)
698.title: Florida Statutes/Rulemaking
698.description: Conforms Florida Statutes to directive of Legislature in s. 9, ch. 2012-116, LOF, codified as s. 11.242(5)(j), F.S., to prepare reviser's bill to omit all statutes & laws, or parts thereof, which grant duplicative, redundant, or unused rulemaking authority.

699.title: Presidential Preference Primary
699.description: Revises date on which presidential preference primary is held.

700.title: School Choice
700.description: Revises provisions relating to charter school application, certain appeals, funding for & payments to charter schools, long-term charters, nonrenewal, termination, & closure of charter schools, financial statements, charter school representatives & public meetings, governing board residency requirements, high-performing charter schools, termination of virtual instruction provider contracts, capital outlay funding, & charter school professional development; authorizes charter school to defer opening & use of certain funds for educational purposes; establishes Florida Charter School Innovation Institute; provides appropriation.

701.title: Department of Transportation
701.description: Revises provisions relating to DOT's organization, Uniform Traffic Control Law, driving on right side of roadway, crosswalks, operating bicycle, commercial motor vehicles, airport zoning, traveler information systems, toll revenue, bonds, toll accounts, adopted work program, transportation concurrency; & directs EDR to determine benefits of investment in DOT's adopted work program.

702.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 7040 (Ch. 2015-32)
702.title: Public Records/Customer E-mail Addresses/DHSMV
702.description: Provides public records exemption for e-mail addresses obtained from customers when conducting driver license or motor vehicle record transactions; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

703.title: Standard Student Attire
703.description: Designates act as "Students Attired for Education (SAFE) Act"; authorizes school boards to adopt standard student attire policy; limits liability for districts that implement attire policy; creates safe schools allocation to provide funding for certain safe schools activities; provides for withholding of funds from districts that do not comply with certain school safety & student discipline reporting; provides for incentive payments to school districts that implement standard student attire policies; provides appropriation.

704.title: State Veterans' Nursing Homes
704.description: Directs DVA to contract for study to determine need for additional state veterans' nursing home & most appropriate county for home; directs DVA to submit study to Governor & Legislature; provides study criteria for ranking each county according to need; requires department to use specified studies to select new veterans' nursing home sites; directs DVA to conduct subsequent studies & to submit studies to Governor & Legislature.

705.title: Bundled Health Care Services
705.description: Requires analysis of medical tourism for bundled health care services in Economic Development Programs Evaluation; requires EFI to collaborate with DEO to market state as health care destination; requires Division of Tourism Marketing to include in 4-year plan discussion of promotion of medical tourism for bundled health care services; provides plan requirements; specifies that direct primary care agreement does not constitute insurance & is not subject to Florida Insurance Code; specifies that entering into such agreement does not constitute business of insurance & is not subject to code; provides that certificate of authority is not required to market, sell, or offer to sell such agreement; specifies criteria for such agreement.

706.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7016 (Ch. 2015-74)
706.title: OGSR/Minor Petitioning Court for Waiver of Parental Notice
706.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for certain information identifying minor petitioning court to waive parental notice requirements before terminating pregnancy.

707.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7008 (Ch. 2015-71)
707.title: OGSR/Board of Funeral, Cemetery, & Consumer Services
707.description: Saves from repeal public meetings exemption for portions of meetings of Board of Funeral, Cemetery, & Consumer Services within DFS at which licensure examination questions or answers are discussed & public records exemption for recording of closed portion of meeting of board; removes scheduled repeal of exemptions.

708.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7010 (Ch. 2015-72)
708.title: OGSR/Office of Financial Regulation Examination Techniques and Procedures
708.description: Removes scheduled repeal of exemption from public records requirements for records that would reveal examination techniques & procedures used by OFR under Florida Securities & Investor Protection Act.

709.last_action: Chapter No. 2015-163, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 676 (Ch. 2015-60)
709.title: Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles
709.description: Revises provisions for funeral expenses for certain officers killed in line of duty, flag displayed when load extends beyond vehicle, permitting of overlength trailers, display of vehicle for sale, hire, or rent, pilot program for rebuilt inspection services, options on application forms, residential manufactured buildings on mobile home lots, specialty & special license plates, disclosure of insurance policy numbers, & emergency allergy treatment.

710.title: School Administration
710.description: Revises provisions relating to a school district strategic plan, internal audits, certain standards for certain personnel & school officers, early warning system for certain students, annual review of certain procedures, compulsory student attendance, professional development, protected school speech, parental access to homework, out-of-field teachers, related records, policies, court hearings, & penalties, high school equivalency diploma, parental notices for exceptional students, bullying & harassment, certain school districts policies, & certain policies for principals, district school boards employees, & suspension of educator certifications.

711.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7061 (Ch. 2015-99)
711.title: Offenses Concerning Racketeering and Illegal Debts
711.description: Authorizes investigative agency to institute civil proceeding for forfeiture in circuit court in certain circumstances; revises grounds for an action; authorizes court to order forfeiture of other property of defendant up to value of unavailable property in certain circumstances; authorizes DLA to bring an action for certain violations; provides for civil penalties for natural persons & other persons; authorizes party to specific civil action to petition for entry of consent decree or settlement agreement & provides requirements; revises provisions relating to subpoena confidentiality; provides that investigative agency has authority to stipulate to protective orders with respect to documents & information submitted in response to subpoena; provides for distribution of forfeiture proceeds to victims.

712.title: Public Records/Florida RICO Act Investigations
712.description: Providing an exemption from public records requirements for certain documents and information held by an investigative agency pursuant to an investigation relating to an activity prohibited under the Florida RICO Act; authorizing disclosure of such documents and information under certain conditions; providing for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

713.title: Child Pornography
713.description: Repeals existing provisions relating to sexual performance by child; prohibits person from using child in sexual performance; prohibits person from promoting sexual performance by child; prohibits person from possessing with intent to promote child pornography; prohibits person from knowingly possessing, controlling, or intentionally viewing child pornography; requires certain conditions of supervision be imposed on certain offenders; prohibits certain offenders from being placed on administrative probation; provides that each act of transmitting child pornography is separate offense; conforms provisions.

714.title: Pub. Rec./Child Pornography
714.description: Expands exemption from public records requirements for criminal intelligence information & criminal investigative information to include information, photographs, videotapes, or images of victims of specified offenses; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; reenacts provisions.

717.title: Traffic Control
717.description: Revises provisions relating to traffic infraction detectors; requires funds retained by county or municipality for traffic infraction detector violations to be used only for certain purposes; revises provisions for reports that counties & municipalities are required to submit to DHSMV; provides for noncompliance with reporting requirements; authorizes DOT to inspect detectors & traffic control devices at intersections with detectors; prohibits notice of violation or uniform traffic citation if detector does not comply with specifications; requires county or municipality to document & make available to DOT its consideration & rejection of certain engineering countermeasures before installing any traffic infraction detector.

718.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 430 (Ch. 2015-9)
718.title: Trust Funds/Termination/Central Florida Beltway Trust Fund/DOT
718.description: Terminates Central Florida Beltway Trust Fund within DOT.

720.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 426 (Ch. 2015-7)
720.title: Trust Funds/Termination/Department of Education
720.description: Terminates Building Fee Trust Fund, Replacement Trust Fund, State University System Concurrency Trust Fund, State University System Law Enforcement Trust Fund, & Uniform Payroll Trust Fund within DOE & BOG; provides for disposition of balances in & revenues of trust funds.

722.title: Ratification of Rules/Minimum Flows & Levels and Recovery & Prevention Strategies/DEP
722.description: Ratifies specified DEP rules relating to minimum flows & levels for the Lower Santa Fe & Ichetucknee Rivers & their associated priority springs, for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness pursuant to s. 120.541(3), F.S.

723.title: Ratification of Rules/Construction & Demolition Debris Disposal and Recycling/DEP
723.description: Ratifies specified DEP rules requiring liners & leachate collection systems at construction & demolition debris disposal facilities, for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness pursuant to s. 120.541(3), F.S.

724.title: Financial Literacy Program for Individuals with Developmental Disabilities
724.description: Establishes Financial Literacy Program for Individuals with Developmental Disabilities within DFS; provides requirements for public & private stakeholders to develop & implement the program; provides limitation on civil actions; provides appropriation.

725.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 428 (Ch. 2015-8)
725.title: Department of Environmental Protection
725.description: Provides for administration & funding of Administrative Trust Fund, Environmental Laboratory Trust Fund, Working Capital Trust Fund; Minerals Trust Fund; & Air Pollution Control Trust Fund; removes provisions authorizing DEP to enter into certain contracts & agreements for pollution control projects relating to clean air and water & to use federal funds for various environmental & natural resource program purposes; provides for deposit of restricted contractual revenue from private & public nonfederal sources to be used for grant or donor agreement activities; authorizes DEP to transfer certain appropriations to Federal Grants Trust Fund; revises percentage of funds distributed from Solid Waste Management Trust Fund to DACS for mosquito control & to DEP for solid waste management grant program.

726.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7012 (Ch. 2015-73)
726.title: OGSR/Credit History Information and Credit Scores/OFR
726.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for credit history information & credit scores held by OFR for purposes of licensing loan originators, mortgage brokers, & mortgage lenders.

727.title: Postsecondary Options for Students with Disabilities
727.description: Creates "Florida Postsecondary Comprehensive Transition Program Act"; establishes Florida Postsecondary Comprehensive Transition Program & Florida Center for Students with Unique Abilities; provides that certain students with a physical or mental disorder are exempt from specified tuition & fees.

728.title: Transportation Facility Designations
728.description: Provides honorary designations of various transportation facilities in specified counties; directs DOT to erect suitable markers.

732.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 7034 (Ch. 2015-78)
732.title: OGSR/Victims of Stalking or Aggravated Stalking
732.description: Transfers, renumbers, & amends provisions relating to exemption from public records requirements for certain information regarding persons who are victims of stalking or aggravated stalking; removes scheduled repeal.

733.title: Public Records/Juvenile Criminal History Records
733.description: Specifies that certain confidential information obtained under ch. 985, F.S., relating to juvenile justice, is exempt from public records requirements; revises applicability of public records requirements with respect to arrest records of certain juvenile offenders; provides for future review & repeal of such applicability provisions; provides exemption from public records requirements for juvenile information compiled by Criminal Justice Information Program from intrastate sources; provides exceptions; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides for release by FDLE of criminal history information of juvenile which has been deemed confidential & exempt; provides statement of public necessity.

734.title: Expunging and Sealing Criminal History Records
734.description: Provides for nonjudicial expunction of criminal history records at age 21 years for minors who are not serious or habitual juvenile offenders; establishes nonjudicial expunction process within FDLE for specified criminal history records; specifies types of records eligible; provides for effect of this expunction; revises provisions relating to court-ordered expunction; revises provisions relating to nonjudicial process within FDLE for sealing of specified records; conforms provisions.

735.title: Pub. Rec./Expunged and Sealed Criminal History Records
735.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for specified records that have been approved for nonjudicial expunction; provides exemption from public records requirements for criminal history records related to withhold of adjudication that have been expunged; provides exemption from public records requirements for criminal history record related to withhold of adjudication or nonviolent misdemeanor conviction that has been approved for nonjudicial sealing; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity.

737.title: Conscience Protection for Actions of Private Child-Placing Agencies
737.description: Prohibits specified actions from being taken against private child-placing agency that refuses to place child or be involved in placement of child or facilitate licensure of foster home which would violate agency's written religious or moral convictions or policies; provides that such refusal does not provide basis for claim for injunctive relief or compensatory or punitive damages.

738.last_action: Died in Appropriations, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1069 (Ch. 2015-178)
738.title: Mental Health Services in the Criminal Justice System
738.description: Expands eligibility for military veterans & servicemembers for certain programs; authorizes creation of treatment-based mental health court programs; authorizes person eligible for participation in problem-solving court to transfer case to another county's problem-solving court; authorizes county court to order conditional release of defendant for outpatient care & treatment; authorizes Forensic Hospital Diversion Pilot Program in specified judicial circuits; provides for courts to order certain defendants on probation or community control to postadjudicatory mental health court programs; expands eligibility requirements for certain pretrial intervention programs; provides eligibility of misdemeanor defendants for misdemeanor pretrial mental health court programs; authorizes pretrial mental health court programs for certain juvenile offenders.

739.title: Capital Recovery
739.description: Requires DFS to maintain list of certain providers on its website; specifies information to be included in capital recovery report & provides procedures for timely reporting; creates process for determining denial rates; requires DFS to contract with approved provider to calculate denial rates for certain hospital districts; requires DFS to maintain list of approved providers; requires hospital districts to meet specified requirements before levying or receiving increased tax revenues; provides that this section supersedes special acts; provides DFS with emergency rulemaking authority; provides appropriation.

740.title: Pub. Rec./Capital Recovery Reports
740.description: Provides exemption from public records requirement for personal identifying information & health information obtained in capital recovery report; authorizes release under certain conditions; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

742.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 7078 (Ch. 2015-79)
742.title: Child Welfare
742.description: Revising duties of critical incident rapid response teams in cases of child deaths; revises duties & purposes of state & local death review committees; specifies that certain responsibilities of DCF be administered at regional level; requires community-based care lead agencies to provide evidence-based & trauma-informed services.

743.last_action: Died in Environmental Preservation and Conservation
743.title: At-risk Vessels
743.description: Prohibits vessels that at risk of becoming derelict from anchoring on, mooring on, or occupying state waters; authorizes FWCC or specified law enforcement officers to determine that vessels are at risk of becoming derelict if certain conditions exist; provides that persons who anchor or moor or allow such a vessel to occupy state waters commit noncriminal violation; provides for enforcement, penalties, & applicability.

744.title: Postsecondary Access and Affordability
744.description: Limiting applicability of state apprenticeship and job-training program requirements with respect to certain provisions for veterans, minority persons, and women; revising provisions relating to textbook affordability to include instructional materials; revising the program standards for career, adult, and community education programs; creating the Florida Apprenticeship Grant Program within the Department of Education to provide grants to specific centers and institutions for the creation of new apprenticeship programs or the expansion of existing apprenticeship programs; creating the Rapid Response Grant Program; creating a University System Performance-Based Incentive to be awarded to state universities that meet certain criteria, etc.

745.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7069 (Ch. 2015-6)
745.title: Higher Education
745.description: Revises provisions relating to apprenticeships, baccalaureate degree programs, career centers & charter technical career centers, applied technology diplomas, common placement test, specified accountability reports, & adult & workforce education programs.

746.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 7032 (Ch. 2015-77)
746.title: OGSR/Child Abuse Death Review Committees
746.description: Expands public records exemption to include information held by State Child Abuse Death Review Committee or local committee that identifies deceased child whose death is not result of abuse or neglect & to include identity of surviving siblings, family members, or others living in home of such deceased child; provides for future review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity.

748.last_action: Died in Military and Veterans Affairs, Space, and Domestic Security
748.title: Military and Veteran Support
748.description: Authorizes local governing bodies to aid & assist veterans with general discharges under honorable conditions in presenting claims for & securing federal & state benefits & privileges; requires that DVA, through a direct-support organization & in consultation with DACS, include certain federal, state, & local information on agriculture & farming opportunities in Florida Veterans' Benefits Guide; exempts veterans with general discharges under honorable conditions from initial licensing, application, & unlicensed activity fees for any license issued by DBPR; requires that DHSMV & DVA jointly conduct pilot program to provide onsite commercial driver license testing opportunities to qualified members of Florida National Guard & submit report to Legislature.

749.last_action: Died in Environmental Preservation and Conservation
749.title: State Lands
749.description: Revises criteria for land management goals & management plan updates; requires Division of State Lands to review conservation & nonconservation lands to determine if such lands could support low-impact agriculture or be disposed of; provides for low-impact agriculture agreements; requires Acquisition & Restoration Council to provide certain recommendations; directs Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund to dispose of lands under certain conditions; provides for certain state-owned lands to be exchanged for certain privately owned land; directs DEP to include certain lands in database; requires local governments to submit certain information to DEP; requires council to give priority funding consideration to certain projects; provides for inclusion of certain projects; directs DEP to consolidate specified parcels of conservation lands; provides appropriations & authorizes positions.

750.title: Extracurricular Activities
750.description: Providing for periodic review of the Florida High School Athletic Association's performance of its duties; requiring the Florida High School Athletic Association (FHSAA) to adopt guidelines, provide resources, and develop training courses relating to sports ethics; revising academic eligibility requirements; revising insurance requirements to include students who participate in nonathletic extracurricular activities; providing a period within which an audit of a nonprofit association's records must be provided to the Auditor General, etc.

751.title: Local Government Capital Recovery
751.description: Requires municipalities that meet certain thresholds for

814.title: Equal Rights for Men and Women
814.description: Ratifies proposed amendment to U.S. Constitution relating to equal rights for men & women.

815.last_action: Signed by Officers and filed with Secretary of State
815.title: Joint Session for Purpose of Receiving Governor's Message
815.description: Calls for House of Representatives & Senate to convene in Joint Session at 11:00 a.m. on March 3, 2015, for purpose of receiving message from Governor.

816.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
816.title: Constitutional Convention/Campaign Finance and Political Speech
816.description: Urges Congress to call convention for purpose of proposing amendments to U.S. Constitution to limit corporate personhood for purposes of campaign finance & political speech & declare that money does not constitute speech & may be legislatively limited.

817.title: The Groveland Four
817.description: Acknowledges grave injustice perpetrated against Charles Greenlee, Walter Irvin, Samuel Shepherd, & Ernest Thomas, known as "Groveland Four"; exonerates four men; offers formal & heartfelt apology to victims & families; & urges Governor & Cabinet to pardon Walter Irvin & Charles Greenlee.

818.last_action: Signed by Officers and filed with Secretary of State
818.title: Confirmation of Auditor General
818.description: Confirms appointment of Sherrill Foltz Norman to position of Auditor General.

819.title: Real Property Rights of Aliens Ineligible for Citizenship
819.description: Proposes amendment to s. 2, Art. I of State Constitution to delete provision authorizing laws that regulate or prohibit ownership, inheritance, disposition, & possession of real property by aliens ineligible for citizenship.

820.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
820.title: Municipal Property Tax Exemption
820.description: Proposes amendment to State Constitution to allow Legislature, by general law after specified date, to exempt from taxation property owned by municipality that is not used for municipal or public purposes.

821.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
821.title: Homestead Exemption/Living Spouse of Deceased Combat-Disabled Veteran
821.description: Proposes amendment to s. 6, Art. VII of State Constitution to authorize living spouse of deceased veteran, who upon death was aged 65 or older, partially or permanently disabled during combat, & honorably discharged, to receive discount on ad valorem taxes on homestead property based on percentage of veteran's disability & to specify that exemption is transferrable to another residence if spouse remains unmarried & uses residence as his or her primary residence.

822.last_action: Died in Finance and Tax Committee
822.title: Homestead Tax Exemption/Senior, Low-Income, Long-Term Residents
822.description: Proposes amendment to s. 6, Art. VII of State Constitution to specify the calculation that county or municipality may use in determining just value for purposes of homestead tax exemption for certain persons 65 or older, if authorized by law.

823.title: Vetoed Appropriations
823.description: Proposes amendment to s. 8, Art. III of State Constitution to require specific appropriations of general appropriation bill which originate from general revenue fund & are vetoed by Governor, but which are not reinstated by two-thirds vote of each house of Legislature in special session, to be transferred to budget stabilization fund & to specify that such amounts do not count toward principal balance limitation of fund.

824.title: Restoration of Rights
824.description: Proposes amendment to State Constitution to authorize Legislature to prescribe additional circumstances under which certain fines & forfeitures may be suspended or remitted, reprieves may be granted, civil rights may be restored, & punishments may be commuted.

825.title: Legislation by Initiative
825.description: Proposes creation of s. 22, Art. III & amendment of s. 10, Art. IV of State Constitution to authorize proposal & enactment of legislation by initiative & provide for Supreme Court review of petitions proposing legislation.

826.title: Miami-Dade County Home Rule Charter
826.description: Proposes amendment to State Constitution to authorize amendments or revisions to Miami-Dade County Home Rule Charter by special law approved by electors of Miami-Dade County; restricts introduction of bill proposing such special law; provides that charter may impose fixed term limits on county commissioners; conforms historical provisions.

828.title: Voter Control of Gambling Expansion in Florida
828.description: Proposes creation of s. 29, Art. X of State Constitution to provide that power to authorize expansion of gambling in Florida is reserved to people; prohibit expansion of gambling unless proposed & approved as constitutional amendment by initiative petition; define "expansion of gambling" & "gambling;" & clarify that amendment does not affect right of Legislature to exercise authority through general law or state's authority regarding tribal-state compacts.

829.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SM 866 (Adopted)
829.title: Diplomatic Relations with Cuba
829.description: Expresses disagreement with decision of Federal Government to restore diplomatic relations with Cuba, opposes opening of Cuban consulate or diplomatic office in Florida, & urges Congress to uphold embargo.

831.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
831.title: Children's Health Insurance Program
831.description: Urges Congress to extend funding for Children's Health Insurance Program through 2019.

832.title: Regulation of Carbon Dioxide Emissions from Fossil Fuel-Fired Electric Generating Units
832.description: Urges U.S. Congress to direct EPA to revise its proposed regulations that address carbon dioxide emissions from existing fossil fuel-fired electric generating units.

834.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
834.title: Repeal of Applications for Article V Constitutional Convention
834.description: Memorial to U.S. Congress, urging Congress to repeal & nullify all existing applications by Florida Legislature that call for Article V constitutional convention.

835.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
835.title: Supportive Housing for the Elderly Program
835.description: Urges U.S. Congress to restore & provide adequate funding for Supportive Housing for the Elderly Program.

836.title: Medical Marijuana
836.description: Urges Congress to remove marijuana from the Schedule I drug list & allow marijuana to be researched & used for medical purposes.

837.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
837.title: Electromagnetic Pulse Threats, Cyber-Attacks, and Geomagnetic Storms
837.description: Urges U.S. Congress to pass legislation & direct Secretary of U.S. Department of Homeland Security to request needed resources to protect against & recover from impacts of serious electromagnetic pulse threats, cyber-attacks, & geomagnetic storms.

838.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
838.title: Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
838.description: Urges U.S. Congress to support passage of legislation similar to Marketplace Fairness Act.

839.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
839.title: Energy
